title: PAN2161 - Bedding Plant supply
description:
Leicester City Council (the Authority) invites Tenders for the provision of summer and winter bedding plants to be supplied for locations in and around Leicester City centre. 
The proposed Contract will be for three years with an option to extend for a period or periods totalling no more than a further one year. We anticipate awarding to a single Supplier.

title: The Provision for the Maintenance of Automatic Doors, Gates, Barriers and Security Shutters
description:
The contract is to provide a maintenance service to Door Gate and Barrier Installations at designated buildings around the force. The contract will provide for planned preventative maintenance, reactive (repair) maintenance and improvement/alteration activities.
The range of equipment covered under this Contract consists of the following:
(1)	Automatic Door Equipment
	a)	Automatic Sliding Doors
	b)	Automatic Folding Doors
	c)	Disabled Person Door Operators
	d)	Automatic Door Operators
(2)	Traffic Barriers
	a)	Traffic Barriers, Keypads, Card readers and Intercoms.

(3)	Gates and Roller Shutters
	a)	Sliding Gates, Swinging Gates, Keypads, Card readers and Intercoms.
	b)	Pedestrian Gates, Keypads, Card readers and Intercoms.

	c)	Roller Security Shutters, Keypads and Intercom.

(4)	Enquiry Counter Shutters
	a) 	Fast Action Security Roller Shutters including canteen fire shutter
	b) 	Alarm Interfaces
	c)	Emergency Power Battery Packs
(5)	Moveable Walls / Room Partitions

(6)	Coded locks - number changes and replacement mechanisms but no maintenance
streetaddress: Police Headquarters, Lloyd House, Colmore Circus Q

title: Refugee Resettlement Support Services for Lincolnshire
description: City of Lincoln, North Kesteven District, South Holland District and South Kesteven District Councils have accepted Syrian refugee families within their authority areas. The Councils are seeking to enter into contract with a suitable Supplier for the provision of Refugee Resettlement Support Services which includes (but is not limited to): (1) Welcoming new arrivals at the airport and providing welcome packs on arrival at the airport and the accommodation (2) Liaising with the Authority to deliver the Biometric Residence Permits following arrival (3) Developing and auctioning support plans for the families and individuals (4) Providing a dedicated source of advice, guidance, information, signposting, support and advocacy (5) Managing the expectations of the family to ensure they do not become reliant on either the local Authority or the Support Worker (6) Visiting families and accompanying them to appointments, drop in / training sessions, etc., in order to: (a) Assist with registering for benefits and services and signposting to other advice, information and agencies (b) Register with local nurseries, schools or colleges, English Language and Literacy classes and other appropriate training (c) Register with local GP's and other healthcare providers in line with any identified medical or mental health needs (d) Attend local Job Centre Plus appointments for benefit assessments and access to employment (e) Help with opening a bank account - ensuring people know their rights and are able to manage their finances (f) Where required, help with understanding tenancy agreements and addressing any problems (some Authorities may wish to provide this element themselves) (g) Help set up accounts for utilities (h) Show them around their new local area, helping them get to grips with public transport, buy familiar food, find their local library, places of worship and other community facilities and volunteering opportunities (i) Support with budgeting, wellbeing, skills development and employment readiness (j) Take active steps to reduce isolation, ensure integration and connecting people to their communities and encouraging local support networks (k) Help local communities and services to become refugee-friendly (l) Develop support plans for families and individuals (m) Help with asylum and immigration issues (7) Ensuring / confirming that other agencies interacting with the refugee have made telephone interpretation services available for appointments, etc. (8) Provide updates on the progress of families and individuals to the local Authority  Further information is available via the ProContract system https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=d3325d7a-e232-ea11-80fc-005056b64545

title: Tunnelling Technical Support for the works to Design and Construct the Kingsway Tunnel Drainage Replacement Service Tunnels
description:
The Merseytravel is seeking to employ a suitably qualified Tunnelling Engineering Consultant to provide engineering and project management support for the works to Design and Construct the Kingsway Tunnels Drainage Replacement Service Tunnels. The works are within the Kingsway Tunnels and Promenade Vent Station.

Merseytravel operates the two River Mersey underwater road crossing tunnels between Liverpool and Wallasey, Liverpool and Birkenhead in Merseyside. The Kingsway road tunnel is a twin tube tunnel, completed in 1971 and 1974, carries two traffic lanes under the River Mersey between Liverpool and Wallasey, Maximum speed is limited to 40 mph and annual throughput traffic is 13.5 million.

Merseytravel would welcome interest from suitably qualified Tunnelling Engineering Consultant on Lot 1 Tunnels Engineering Consultancy of the Merseytravel Consultancy Services Multiparty Framework 2019 - 2023 to provide engineering and project management support required.

title: DDP031 Provision of Cash Collection Service
description:
The Council is seeking to procure a Cash Management Service from a Security Industry Authority approved contractor to consist of the collection, counting, reconciliation and banking of monies from designated Council Offices, 'pay and display' car park ticket machines and public conveniences entry turnstiles in the District of Derbyshire Dales, to provide a change facility for the annual Matlock Bath Illuminations event and to provide a cash collection service from Matlock Bath Illuminations event.
The contract is being let as 2 lots as detailed below (Bidders may bid for 1 or more lots.):
Lot 1 
Cash Collection from Council Offices;
Cash Collections from Car Park Pay and Display Machines;
Cash Collection from public Conveniences; and
Collection and delivery of envelopes between office and satellite points.
Lot 2
Provision of a cash float to the Matlock Bath Illuminations.
Cash Collection from Matlock Bath Illuminations.

title: Insights Project - Developing Insights Matrix of Company Issues
description:
Gather relevant Ofwat sources of data 

This involves pulling together data and other sources of information from across Ofwat, including consideration of how best to include softer sources of information and intelligence.  

Desk based research for any newly identified information sources  

The key focus is on information that will help us to develop greater insights into the performance of the water companies and the main issues affecting the water sector, including social value and environmental challenges.  

Structure information for reporting and develop appropriate presentation of information 

Includes consideration of how best to future proof the matrix, so that additional information can be added over time. It must also take a holistic view across the companies/sector, and not be limited to the current Ofwat programme structures.  

Develop draft matrix for review by Ofwat 
The main focus here is on ease of use, so that the matrix is easily accessible and understood by a wide range of internal colleagues.  

Complete matrix, refined to reflect feedback from Ofwat 

We anticipate that this will be an iterative process over the period of the contract. The matrix must be able to be easily maintained and developed by Ofwat staff after the contract ends.   

Recommend next steps and provide strategic guidance on further development of insights 

To share learning from the process of creating the matrix, and to advise on how to further develop it to continue to develop greater insights into the water sector. This may include consideration of Ofwat's processes, ways of working and developing structures, as well as advising how the matrix can best be developed to complement the company thumbnails.  

Communicate findings (paper/presentation to Senior Responsible Officer (SRO) and/or Programme Board as required).

title: 1-1025 P4102020 LST Evaluation
description: The Department for Transport (DfT) is looking to set up a contract for provision of follow-on work consisting of further research and evaluation of the Longer Semi-Trailer trial. The trial has been running since 2012 and currently involves over 2500 vehicles operating on a trial basis across the UK. This contract would be a continuation of the data collection, monitoring, and evaluation of the trial by external independent contractors.

title: Minor Civils Framework
description: Salford City Council is to bring planning and building control services, property, and highways and infrastructure back in-house once the current contract with Urban Vision ends in January 2020. The council is looking for suitably qualified contractors to apply for it Minor Civils Frameworks. The term of the Framework Agreement will be for up to 18 months. Lot 1 - Single Award for works up to £150,000 2. Lot 2 - Mini Competition for works over £150,000 and up to £500,000.

title: Group Based Short Break Care Services for Children with a Disabiolity in Salford Aged 5 - 11 years
description: Group Based Short Break Care Services for Children with a Disabiolity in Salford Aged 5 - 11 years.The purpose of this provision is to provide high quality community-based services, enabling disabled children to participate in activities that they enjoy.  The contract is for an 18 month period with a possible 12 month extension.  The documents can be downloaded via the e-procurement site the Chest www.the-chest.org.uk.  You can register free of charge on the site and download the documents free of charge.  The documents must be uploaded back onto the Chest by no later than 16:00 hours Thursday 26th March, 2020

title: 2-240 Commercial Management and Assurance for the Smart Motorways Programme - Tranche 5 projects
description:
Highways England (HE) is looking to award a work package for the provision of commercial services and support for the Smart Motorways Programme. 
Commercial management services are required to commence on the 1st April 2020 and continue until 31st March 2021 to deliver the services detailed in Section 3, to support the Highways England integrated teams on projects (as listed below) and to manage the commercial and contractual issue during the transition into the Alliance and to support other related commercial processes and functions across the SMP programme. 
Tranche 5 projects 
M3 J9-14
M40-M42 Interchange
M62 J20-25
A1 (M) J6-8

title: UK SBS - CR20011 - The Value of Fellowships
description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids was Monday, 17th February 2020 at 11:00am.

Brief Description of Requirement

The study should establish a benchmark for EPSRC fellowship investments and analyse strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats to a continued programme of fellowship investments and compare against fellowship offerings from other funding agencies using readily available data and reports.

This contract was awarded based on the evaluation criteria set out in the Mini Competition Document.

title: Artificial Intelligence-Powered Content Curation and Self-Assessment Education Tool
description:
Background

The way learners access education is changing and increasingly incorporates learning from third-party websites and systems, not just those provided to them via HEE's own platforms and systems. However, finding the best and most appropriate resources can be difficult.

HEE is committed to the building of a digital ready workforce that can use technology effectively to support individuals and patients with their health and care in the present and as new technologies emerge in the future. To benchmark and develop these digital capabilities, it is necessary to assess the current levels of digital literacy in the health and care workforce.

The objective of this project is to develop and pilot a tool that will allow users to diagnose capability gaps according to HEE's digital capabilities framework, making recommendations of learning resources based on the gaps, and then enable participants to re-assess their abilities based on what they have learned, using artificial intelligence to tag and identify resources.

Scope of Contract

We are seeking a partner to work with us and provide a method of assessing an individual's capabilities against the HEE digital literacy framework and making personalised recommendations from our existing catalogue of content and third-party curated content.

The way learners access education is changing and increasingly incorporates learning from third-party websites and systems, not just those provided to them via HEE's own platforms and systems. However, finding the best and most appropriate resources can be difficult.

HEE is committed to the building of a digital ready workforce that can use technology effectively to support individuals and patients with their health and care in the present and as new technologies emerge in the future. To benchmark and develop these digital capabilities, it is necessary to assess the current levels of digital literacy in the health and care workforce.

title: Cleaning Services (AH-235) - AWARD
description:
This procurement is for the provision of cleaning services and window cleaning within the North Somerset and surrounding areas. This procurement relates to services largely to be provided in the North Somerset area but could also include the following areas: Bristol, South Gloucestershire, Bath and North East Somerset, Sedgemoor local / unitary authority areas and also in the Swindon area (such as SN1 to SN5, SN25 and SN26 postcodes). Any such increase would be at the agreement of both parties.  
      
      The services covered by this procurement exercise have been subdivided into 3 lots as follows:
      LOT 1 - Cleaning - communal areas, sheltered schemes, office cleaning and external window cleaning
      LOT 2 - Cleaning - void properties
      LOT 3 - Cleaning - Tamar Court
      Tenderers may tender for one, several or all lots. 
      
      The duration of the contract for each lot is 3 years with the potential to extend for 2 additional 12 month periods (up to a total of 5 years). AHG intends to award the contracts on 4th February 2020 to go live on 1st April 2020

title: Taxonomy Indexer, Data Connector and Search Service Provision
description:
Background

The way learners access education is changing and increasingly incorporates learning from third-party websites and systems, not just those provided to them via HEE's own platforms and systems. Many of those systems contain poorly structured data that needs indexing, enriching and aggregating so that it can be searchable through HEE's websites.

The TEL programme is in the process of developing a new learning product for everyone working in health and care in the UK. The Learning Hub will be a powerful new digital platform that will provide easy access to a wide range of education and training resources for the health and care workforce.

The Learning Hub will be the place to go to access and record learning from a broad range of shareable resources, including existing e-Learning for Healthcare (e-LfH) programmes, and resources contributed and uploaded from the user community. The Learning Hub will also encourage discussions to take place around the uploaded learning content and networks to form around areas of shared interest to maximise the opportunities for collaboration and realise the potential of the resources.

HEE have invested in the implementation and development of a taxonomy management system (Pool Party) and have developed a range of taxonomies and knowledge graphs. Currently, search is provided through the Open-source Elastic search tool. However, connecting these to a search tool in the Learning Hub and making the most of indexing our extensive range of learning resources has proved difficult and we have yet to maximise the value from the taxonomy investment and development.

Scope of Contract

We are seeking a partner to work with us and provide a method of connecting our Pool Party instance to the Learning Hub and other HEE systems through a taxonomy and resource indexer, data connector and search service provision, so that it becomes more than just a simple index and search bar.

All software needs to be hosted on-premise through HEE's Azure instance.

title: HMS VICTORY Conservation Project Materials Trials
description: HMS Victory, situated within Portsmouth Historic Dockyard, is a World Class Historic Vessel and an exemplar of a capital warship from the Age of Sail. In addition to being a unique historic asset, not only as an exemplar of a capital warship from the Age of Sail, but as a warship with a famous fighting career, HMS Victory continues to be a significant visitor attraction within the setting of No. 2 Dock and Portsmouth Historic Dockyard. Furthermore, HMS Victory continues to serve as a commissioned warship, and is the Flagship of the Royal Navy's First Sea Lord. It is also for these reasons that it is imperative to sustain her considerable heritage values for this and future generations.  The overall aim of the conservation project is to keep HMS Victory in the open air for 50 years, requiring only routine conservation maintenance. The NMRN wishes to conduct materials trials of paint, caulking materials and fixings in order to evaluate and down-select the materials most suited to meet the long term requirement, and is seeking assistance to conduct these trials.

title: Personalisation for Learner Motivation in Healthcare
description:
Background

The way learners access education is changing and increasingly incorporates learning from third-party websites and systems, not just those provided to them via HEE's own platforms and systems. However, finding the best and most appropriate resources can be difficult and as such personalised messaging to motivate learners has been a proven technique.

Research conducted by HEE with the University of Leeds explored the use of personalised nudges for learner motivation in healthcare, aiming to better support and motivate NHS staff when using e-learning resources. As part of the study two surveys were conducted with medical students at the University of Leeds. The initial results of using text-derived user characteristics for personalising nudges were promising, and the natural next step is to conduct a survey with staff at an NHS Trust, first analysing their personality and thinking styles from text samples using natural language processing and machine learning algorithms, then showing differing motivational messages to the learner.
Scope of Contract

We are seeking a higher education partner and/or SME in collaboration with a higher education partner to work with us and scale this work up so that we can test different motivational techniques with learners in an NHS workplace setting.

title: UK SBS PR19096 ION CHROMATOGRAPHY SYSTEM
description:
**The final date and time for the submission of bids is 27/01/2020 at 11:00. DO NOT apply directly to the buyer. All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.**

This requirement is for Ion Chromatography System that is capable of analysing the ion contents of ionic liquids (eg anion purity, halide impurities), anion or cation counterions in surfactants (eg sodium, lithium, potassium dodecylsulfates, metal ion impurities eg Ca) and potentially analysis of carbohydrates and amino acids, full details of which are contained in the UK SBS PR19096 Specification Document.

This requirement for ISIS pulsed neutron and muon source which is a world-leading centre for research at the Science & Technology Facilities Council (STFC), Rutherford Appleton Laboratory (RAL) near Oxford, in the UK. Our suite of neutron and muon instruments give unique insights into the properties of materials on the atomic scale.

The ISIS Deuteration Facility supports ISIS Users experiments by providing deuterated compounds for use within beamline experiments. The group is responsible for the synthesis of simple and more often large complex compounds. Part of this, we have a requirement to analyse the samples produced before handing over to the users. The type of samples that we produce range from simple perdeuterated fatty acids to complex surfactants where purity with respect to ion content is important. For certain systems the presence of other ions can have a major effect on the outcome of beamline experiments.

title: Supply of PPE and Site Equipment Supplies
description:
The framework will provide EEM Members with a provision for the supply of PPE and site equipment supplies.Suppliers appointed to the framework will be capable of providing the supply and distribution of personalprotective equipment and site equipment supplies via a range of methods, covering the following areas whichmay be enhanced or refined by contracting authorities under their call-off process;
Workwear
- Trousers
- Polo Shirts
- Sweatshirts
- T-Shirts
- Fleece
- Thermal Wear
- Jackets
- Hi-Visibility Clothing
- Weather Wear
PPE
- Breathing Apparatus
- Eye and Face Protection
- Fall Management
- Head Protection
- Hearing Protection
- Respiratory Protection
- Hand Protection
- Safety Footwear
- Body Protection
Site Equipment
- Spill Containment and Control
- Signage
- Safety Equipment
- Ladders and Access Equipment
- Janitorial Supplies and Washroom Hygiene
- Traffic Management
- First Aid
And any other additional products that can be covered as work-wear, PPE or site equipment supplies.

It  is  the  Council's  intention  to  award  2  Suppliers  onto the  Framework  Agreement. 
      
      There is no guarantee the Council require the services under this Framework Agreement  and  the Council  does  not  guarantee  any  level  of  spend  or  volume  of  Services through the Framework Agreement.

title: Service Design - Private Rented Sector Housing
description:
Provision of an independent review and challenge to how services are currently designed and being delivered within the Private Rented Sector Housing (PRSH) service
Engagement with users of the PRSH services, including (but not limited to) tenants, landlords, and staff with a view to:
a)	Understand user needs
b)	Improve service delivery
c)	Make the most of existing technology
d)	Identify and recommend areas for improvement, to enable the Council to potentially develop and deploy improved processes and technologies
Within the work package the Contractor will take the lead role for the service design activities and will ensure knowledge and skills are transferred to existing staff assigned to the work package.

title: CPU 3652 Production of Immersive Experience for Robin Hood Gallery
description: As part of the Nottingham Castle Museum & Art Gallery project, we require a Contractor to deliver an immersive interactive experience for the new Robin Hood gallery.These will require strong editorial, high production values and seamless technical execution. We require a Contractor to deliver a series of AV assets - working with the Nottingham Castle team throughout pre-production, production, post-production and implementation to ensure the work meets the included brief and fulfils the broader aims. The scope of this contract includes: - Pre-production development, scripting and storyboarding of all elements - Opportunities for client input on the above - Full production and post-production work of all elements - Delivery of final high-quality assets in appropriate formats for AV material - Advice on implementation - Assistance with implementation - including ensuring AV syncing works seamlessly - Handover documentation/scripts - Staff training for those involved in delivering this experience - 12-month warranty support for final elements of interactive experience from the opening of the new exhibition.

title: 2347/MH Test Automation Consultancy for Student Lifecycle Project
description:
The University of Sheffield is out to tender on behalf of the Strategic Change Office for Test Automation Consultancy for the Student Lifecycle Project.

Scope of Requirement:

The full technical specification can be found in the tender documentation which will be sent to you once you have expressed your interest. 


Tender Process and Documentation:

This is a non-EU open exercise. The ITT can be downloaded by registering and expressing your interest on the University`s e-tendering system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield.

If you have any questions or comments in relation to this tender they must be submitted via the In-tend System, this can be accessed at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield

Completed tenders must be returned through the same e-tendering system.

Closing date for receipt of tenders: Tuesday 27th August 2019 at 17:00 (UK time).

title: Alternative Provision  Dynamic Purchasing System
description:
Doncaster Borough Council (The Council) is seeking to appoint a range of Contractors able to provide Alternative Provision for children and young people, aged 8-19 many who are not able to attend their usual school or setting many of whom have severe difficulties in managing their emotions and behaviour. The successful applicants must be able to appropriately meets the needs of pupils and enable them to achieve good educational attainment, which is aligned to that of their mainstream peers. The successful provider must also be able to supplement learning through the provision of a broad range of holistic interventions

The Council is proposing to appoint Contractors through the application of a modified Dynamic Purchasing System established under the Light touch Regime

The DPS will consist of 3 Lots:

Lot 1: Provision to promote engagement and/or reengagement to mainstream school
Lot 2: Provision to support Special Educational Needs and Disabilities
Lot 3: 5 day SEMH provision

Contractors are invited to apply for one, more than one, or all Lots.

The Dynamic Purchasing system for the supply of Alternative Provision will be initially 36 months in length, with two further optional 12 month extension periods, subject to the provision of available funding and the strategic priorities of the Council

title: London and Quadrant Housing Trust - Archaeological Framework  2020 - 2024
description:
London and Quadrant Housing Trust and its subsidiary Quadrant Construction Services are one of the largest providers of affordable housing in the UK, housing over 250,000 people in more than 95,000 homes, primarily across London and the South East of England. London and Quadrant Housing Trust are tendering for the provision of Archaeological Services for London and Quadrant's Self Delivered New Build Projects to comply with the Public Contracts regulations 2015. The objective of this tender process is to establish a Framework Agreement with the tenderers and London and Quadrant Housing Trust. The dates and contract value are estimates and could be subject to change. This is tender is for Service providers only. 
      
      This is a two stage tender and both stages adhere to the time-scales as prescribed within the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 for Restricted OJEU Tenders.
      
      Stage 1: Selection Stage
      
      Click on the 'Express Interest' Button at the bottom
      
      Click on the 'Selection Stage' Tab at the top
      - Scroll to the bottom of the screen and you will be able to view the Tender Documents and access the Standard Selection Questionnaire
      - For the Selection Stage you will only need to submit the Standard Selection Questionnaire
      - We will score your questionnaire and will advise you as to whether you are successful or not
      - Pricing Documents will only be available to those who have passed the Selection Stage
      
      
      ONLY IF YOU HAVE PASSED THE SELECTION STAGE 
      
      Stage 2: ITT Stage
      
      - Click on the 'ITT' Tab 
      - Scroll to the bottom and you will be able to access the Tender Documents
      - Tenderers will be briefed as to what they will need to submit for this tender
      
      Please allow sufficient time to submit your return by the specified dates as late returns will not be permitted. 
      
      
      Under the Framework Agreement L&Q and all companies within the L&Q Group (including, without limitation, Quadrant Construction Services) will have the option to call-off contracts with individual framework contractors as and when required. In addition, other Social Housing Providers in the UK (both those that are in existence now and those that may be in existence in the future) will also be entitled to call-off contracts under the Framework Agreement. "Social Housing Provider" for this purpose means any provider of social housing and includes, without limitation, Registered Providers, Local Authorities and ALMOs. Such Social Housing Providers will only be entitled to call off under the Framework Agreement if L&Q consents.
      
      For information regarding this tender please contact the Framework Team via the tender portal. This tender is managed by the Framework Buying department. Please do not contact any other department within the London and Quadrant Group. Please do not contact Group Procurement for information as this Tender has been created by the Framework Buying Department.

title: Mid Sussex District Council - Pest Control Services
description:
The contract is to provide a pest control service to the residents of Mid Sussex District Council. The service shall be provided on a concession basis whereby all payments shall be made by the customer directly to the service provider. The pest control contract will cover at a minimum the treatment of infestations of rats, mice, fleas, wasps, bedbugs, cockroaches, food and textile pests and other pests as required across the district.
      
      The contract will last for a period of five years with the option to extend for an additional two years.

title: Provision of Replacement Ultracentrifuge Rotor
description:
Public Health England (PHE) requires the provision of a rotor for its National Infections Service in Porton. The proposal must be able to deliver the g force necessary to concentrate the protein from a maximum volume. The rotor must be compatible with the Sorvall 100SE Discovery & WX Ultracentrifuge. 

The rotor will need to meet all the mandatory requirements listed below:
-	The rotor must be capable of 50,000x rpm or 301,032 xg 
-	The rotor must have a centrifuge K factor of 68.7 
-	The rotor must not weigh more than 11.1kg 
-	The rotor's radius no wider than 108mm 
-	Be capable of holding tubes 12 x 36ml #03719
-	The angle of the tubes must be 24°

If you feel that you can meet the above requirements, please email dhavan.abiyani@phe.gov.uk

The closing date and time for any queries is the 24th of February 2020 at 5.00 pm.

title: Selnet Ltd - Partnership Opportunity: Employability Skills Provision for Building Better Opportunities - Age of Opportunity Project (East Lancashire)
description:
Applications are invited from suitably qualified and experienced organisations to provide employability skills support to Age of Opportunity participants from specified Boroughs within Lancashire (Blackburn, Burnley, Hyndburn, Pendle, Rossendale).  Proposals are sought from organisations that can demonstrate competence in delivering relevant support to people aged over 50 with multiple and complex barriers into employment, training or education. The delivery partner will be expected to carry out a diagnostic assessment with potential participants to determine eligibility, suitability and need.  This will be followed by a comprehensive action plan to agree a course of action for the eligible participant, which will improve their lives and ultimately take them closer to work or learning.  The delivery partner will be the key contact and support provider for the participant and will also introduce the participant to a variety of specialist services should they be needed, some of which will be other BBO funded services. These specialist services may include, financial capability support, digital skills, volunteering, business start-up support, and emotional wellbeing help. 
The successful applicant will become an Age of Opportunity Delivery Partner and will sign the Partnership Agreement alongside current partners.

title: Medical Services for Events
description:
The City of Sunderland holds various events throughout each year which are hosted by the Council.  The events range from small half day events where a few hundred people attend to large multi-day events where thousands of people attend.  Some events are a one-off occurrence and others have been running for multiple years.  The Council may also introduce new events as need arises.  Most of the events hosted by the Council required medical services provision to be available on the site of the event for the whole time the event is being held.      The Service is divided into two Lots:

•	Lot 1 - First Aid Led Medical Services - This Lot will cover general events which will be events requiring first aid led medical services only.

•	Lot 2 - Emergency Medicine Doctor Led Medical Service - This Lot will cover large scale events which will require an Emergency Medicine Doctor led medical service.

title: Analogue Studies: Use of Derived Learning & Knowledge in the Evolving UK GDF Programme and Safety Case (1)
description: RWM will need to produce an appropriate safety case that leverages the UK and international knowledge base on analogues potentially relevant to radioactive waste management and the disposal concepts it is considering. Acknowledging this, objectives of the current project, to foster greater use of analogues in RWM's evolving Disposal System Safety Case (DSSC). Interaction with the work of the international Natural Analogue Working Group (www.natural-analogues.com) is highly likely to be beneficial as part of this project. This forum usefully records the status of natural analogue studies in a range of international organisations, WMOs and otherwise.   Where beneficial to the current project, the consultant shall engage with and learn from national and international peer organisations. RWM shall be involved in  any such interactions.

title: SCR Modern Methods of Construction (MMC) Audit - Eco System & Opportunity
description:
Sheffield City Region Mayoral Combined Authority (SCRMCA) is seeking proposals for a Modern Methods of Construction (MMC) Audit. Sheffield City Region (SCR) has the ambition to be the national centre of excellence and to become the 'go to place' for MMC. SCRMCA require support to understand the scale of the opportunity, its assets and the action required to support this ambition. The intention behind this piece of work is to define the opportunity that MMC could present for the 4 South Yorkshire authorities in the SCR (Barnsley, Rotherham, Doncaster and Sheffield), define the eco-system that already exists within the region and set out the steps SCRMCA could take to nurture and support this emerging market.

For more details and to apply, please visit:
https://sheffieldcityregion.org.uk/explore/funding-opportunities/
buyer: Barnsley, Doncaster, Rotherham and Sheffield Combined Authority

title: Analysis and Publication of UK Library Services and Performance
description:
DCMS are supporting CIPFA's analysis of the services and performance of 124 out of the 150 library authorities in England, and the publication and distribution of this analysis to each of the responding library authorities. 

The Comparative Profiles are compiled using data from CIPFA's Annual Public Libraries Statistics (published in December each year) - the only comprehensive available analysis of data relating to library services in England.  The profiles enhance the evidence database for the public library service in England and allow local authorities to compare and contrast against other similar authorities learning from their practice and enabling them to meet the challenge of providing a comprehensive and efficient service - in accordance with their statutory duty. 

CIPFA will provide each of the 124 library authorities, that contributed their library data for the production of CIPFA's Annual Public Library Statistics 2018/19, to receive individual and a unique set of reports that provides them with their library data / performance and compares it with:

- all other English local authorities
- all other local authorities in the same geographical region; and
- to its CIPFA "nearest neighbour" grouping
buyer: DEPARTMENT FOR DIGITAL, CULTURE, MEDIA & SPORT

title: Provision of Postal Goods and Services - CCS Framework RM1063 (Lot 1)
description: Provision of postal goods and services, including collection and delivery of outgoing mail. The contract will initially run for a period of three (3) months from 01 August 2020 to 31 October 2020 (with an estimated value of £105,000), with the option to extend the contract by a further three (3) month period up to 31 January 2021. The contract has been awarded via CCS Framework RM1063 (Lot 1).

title: Executive Sensei Programme - NHS Executive Lean Coaching and Mentoring
description:
NHS Trust Development Authority requires delivery of expert coaching and mentoring (Executive Sensei) support to NHS Chief Executive's and Boards to augment their Lean development as part of the Vital Signs Programme.
Vital Signs is a programme to enable an NHS Improvement Practice to help transform and continuously improve the delivery of what patients want and value with the best use of resources founded on Lean Principles and Systems Thinking to promote improvement stream unification around a common target of an NHS Improvement Practice. Vital Signs is a learning network to support all those on the improvement journey in the NHS no matter their starting point, current position, improvement model, or coach/sensei.

title: Tulse Hill - Environmental Improvements
description: The Council is seeking an experienced provider to carry out environmental improvements to the Tulse Hill Estate consisting of 882 properties.   The Council is seeking to fulfil its health and safety obligations by carrying out essential repairs to the estate roads. In addition, the improvements have been designed to contribute towards reducing anti-social behaviour, improving air quality and creating community cohesion.

title: Social Prescribing for NHS Warwickshire North and NHS Coventry & Rugby CCGs
description:
NHS Arden & GEM CSU on behalf of NHS Coventry and Rugby and NHS Warwickshire North CCGs is oinviting suitably qualified and experienced providers to express an interest in delivering a Social Prescribing Service across the Coventry & Rugby and Warwickshire Norht areas and a Link Worker Service in the Warwickshire North area.

The NHS Long Term Plan outlined its intentions for the roll out of the NHS Personalised Care model across the country, reaching 2.5 million people by 2023/24 and then aiming to double that again within a decade. As part of this work, through social prescribing the range of support available to people will widen, diversify and become accessible across the country. Link workers within primary care networks will work with people to develop tailored plans and connect them to local groups and support services. Over 1,000 trained social prescribing link workers will be in place by the end of 2020/21 rising further by 2023/24, with the aim that over 900,000 people are able to be referred to social prescribing schemes by then. This procurement will assist the CCG in meeting these objectives.

This contract will be let for a period of 4 years with an option to extend for a further 12 months at the sole discretion of the commissioner.
buyer: NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands Commissioning Support Unit

title: Home Support CQC Regulated Services - Manningham (Area 2) and Thackley
description:
Further to the award of the Home Support CQC Regulated Services Contracts earlier this year, the City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council has found it necessary to re-provision services in two specific Locality areas, and therefore seeks tenders from providers of Home Support services for personalised support and care to adults in the Manningham and Thackley areas.

The purpose of this contract will be the delivery of a range of personal care and domestic/community support services to individuals in their own homes and will cover support to older people and those with support needs relating to learning disabilities, mental health and/or physical disabilities

title: Anti-Social Behaviour Partnership Case Management IT System
description: An Anti-Social Behaviour partnership case management IT system is required to provide a means to record incidents, share information, identify repeat vulnerable victims and perpetrators by locality. It must allow for a multi-agency approach to the management of cases. It should be capable of being used as a generic information and case management system as the partnership may, in the future, wish to extend usage to other areas, for example Integrated Offender Management and Domestic Abuse.

title: Social Media Monitoring Software
description: DCMS News and Comms use social media monitoring for two main purposes. The first to measure engagement with our digital media output, including twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram as well as gov,uk content. Secondly we require social media monitoring to gain insight into our digital audiences while planning news announcements and campaigns.

title: RFQ - DAQ system for FSI
description:
The requirements set by NPL is for improving the data acquisition speed in a novel bench-top coordinate metrology system (CMS), which emulates GPS in operation. Currently the system relies on using a 10 MS/s 14-bit data acquisition (DAQ) system with serial connection to a PC. This setup is not adequate for the new implementation of the instrument, for which we need to acquire signals at a sampling rate up to ~160 MS/s, as well as transfer the acquired data to a PC/GPU device for data processing.

We here enquire for a set of DAQ cards that can be integrated in our CMS.

The set-up of the CMS consists of a central hub and 5 sensor heads distributed over a volume of 20 m x 20 m x 10 m. The central hub needs to acquire 4 signals, whereas the sensor heads need to acquire 2 signals each. A common clock and trigger signal are used to control the data acquisition on the central hub and sensor heads.

title: PQ0234 - European Social Fund Progression Pathway for Adults World of Work Project: Health & Social Care Sector Training  - AWARD
description:
Birmingham City Council requires a provider for the provision of Health and Social Care sector specific training to support the delivery of the WoW project objectives.  This contract requires the delivery of demand led health and social care training level to meet participant's needs on the WoW project. 
      
      Health and Social Care Sector Training: Demand led Health and Social Care sector specific training for unemployed or inactive WoW participants linked to employment opportunities within the health and social care sector, across all social care settings, including in residential care homes, primary care services, domiciliary care, day services and assisting supported living.
      
      This contract will deliver a flexible programme of training focussing on supporting unemployed and inactive participants into the health and social care sector across Birmingham and Solihull.  
      
      Training must be delivered in a number of accessible venues across Birmingham and Solihull where demand is identified. 
      
      The training provision must not duplicate/replace existing mainstream provision. 
      
      This contract will be for a period of 9 months commencing 01 December 2019 until 30 September 2020, subject to compliance and satisfactory performance. 
      
      Registration and use of in-tend is free. All correspondence for this procurement process must be via the in-tend correspondence function. If you are unable to register with in-tend please either email us at cps@birmingham.gov.uk or call 0121 464 8000. 
      
      If you are interested in tendering please click on the following link to access the Council's tender Portal:- https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register as a bidder. 
      
      Your completed quotation documentation should be returned by noon 12th November 2019 via the 'in-tend' system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc

title: Outpatient Video Consultation Pilot Evaluation
description: As part of a national outpatient improvement offer, NHS England and NHS Improvement are piloting a nationally supported and deployed video consultation platform with a number of trusts across England. Supported by a small national project team of three WTEs, the project commenced in April 2019 and will run until December 2020. The project team procured a suitable video platform via competitive tender and it has since been deployed to trusts via sub-licence arrangements. Participant trusts are at varying stages of implementation, while some have fully deployed the platform, others are still in the early planning stage. The solution is wholly web-based, conforms to the highest security standards, is IG compliant and has been proven to work at scale in the NHS in Scotland and across Australia in many clinical specialties. The platform is to be piloted in circa 35 trusts across approximately 120 individual services in areas such as paediatrics, respiratory, orthopaedics, diabetes, cancer services and mental health services. NHS England and NHS Improvement now seek to procure an evaluation study of the pilot to better understand the impact of outpatient video consultations on both NHS providers and service users and the impact of the national team's role in enabling adoption. The learnings from the evaluation will enhance NHS England and NHS Improvement's understanding of the impact of video on care delivery and its potential to contribute to long term plan commitments.  The findings will also inform consideration of a more systematic, nationally supported, roll-out of video consulting capability across the NHS in England beyond the pilot.

title: FM20012 - Mobile CCTV Response Unit
description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids is Monday 23rd March 2020 at 11:00.

DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.

All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.

Brief Description of Requirement

UK SBS on behalf of South Tees Site Company Limited (STSC) wishes to establish a contract for a Mobile CCTV Response Unit including operatives to operate at the site in Redcar.

This flexible mobile solution needs to deliver the highest productivity at the lowest operational cost by combining fixed patrol routes and targeted operations, with video analytics to automatically capture accurate video evidence. It will also be used to capture and report environmental offences such as fly-tipping, as well as site safety and crime prevention activities, in-line with our Site Security Policy

Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Document Uploads tab within the Delta eSourcing Portal. 

This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria set out in the RFP document. 

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement. 

To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link https://uksbs.delta-esourcing.com and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://uksbs.delta-esourcing.com and the follow the instructions to 'Login' 

Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: 3375Q4C893

Please disregard any content in this notice that requests your organisation "to apply directly to the buyer" as this unfortunately a system generated error, that is outside of the Contracting Authorities control.

Brief Description of Requirement

UK SBS on behalf of South Tees Site Company Limited (STSC) wishes to establish a contract for a Mobile CCTV Response Unit including operatives to operate at the site in Redcar.

This flexible mobile solution needs to deliver the highest productivity at the lowest operational cost by combining fixed patrol routes and targeted operations, with video analytics to automatically capture accurate video evidence. It will also be used to capture and report environmental offences such as fly-tipping, as well as site safety and crime prevention activities, in-line with our Site Security Policy

title: 7856 Dendrochronology - advanced continued professional development - AWARD
description:
Building future capacity by providing greater access to continuing professional development amongst heritage practitioners has been identified as a key objective in a wide range of recent policy documents. The current cohort of professional (archaeo)dendrochronologists on the UK mainland is rapidly aging and almost all such laboratories are small-sized enterprises. Thus future provision in the heritage sector is under threat. This project is a practical and inventive approach to resolving an imminent structural deficit in dendrochronological provision in the UK.
      
      The aim of this brief is to procure advanced professional training which will be provided by an appropriately experienced established (archaeo)dendrochronology laboratory to a small number of early career (archaeo)dendrochronologists using a series of buildings in Lincoln Cathedral precincts.

title: East Sussex Children and  Adult  Wheelchair and Specialist Seating Service Ref 18.434 Invitation to Tender
description:
The aim of the East Sussex Children and Adult Wheelchair and Specialist Seating Service  is to make sure users optimise their mobility and independence and improve their quality of life through receiving timely access to appropriate assessment, provision and maintenance of equipment through a fully integrated service.

The provider will assess users for the provision of wheeled mobility equipment (both powered and manual) for those with long term mobility problems. Pressure relieving cushions and postural management wheelchair equipment will also be provided to meet the user's long term clinical need. The provider will also assess for specialist static postural seating.

The Wheelchair Charter, developed by the National Wheelchair Leadership Alliance identified a number of ambitions for wheelchair services which the service provider will need to adhere to. These are:
•	A person centred service that works in partnership with service users and their carers and makes the user/carer voice central to any design, innovation and service change.
•	Equality of access and provision for all, irrespective of age or postcode and including essential user skills training as standard.
•	Entry to the service via referral from an appropriately skilled professional. The time from referral to delivery will be at least within the constitutional right of 18 weeks 
•	Assessments for all wheelchairs and associated postural support within nationally mandated timescales and priorities taking into account all aspects of individual needs including those of carers.
•	Establishing regular reviews with the user/carer according to their individual needs.
•	Prescriptions which take into account the current and future needs for all adults and children including those of carers.
•	Delivery, maintenance and emergency backup provided to nationally mandated timescales.
•	Innovative and flexible budgeting working with key partners to strengthen integration across health, social care, work and education, enabling the accommodation of individual needs, independence health and wellbeing.
•	Recruitment of qualified staff in respect of numbers and skills, with support for on-going development and training.
•	Supporting clinicians, manufacturers and independent organisations working together to develop innovative, affordable products and solutions.

The service will commence on 1st July 2020.

The contract will be for 3 years and 9 months duration. Commissioners reserve the right to extend for up to a further 24 months. The value stated represents the value of the primary duration (3 years and 9 months).

An electronic process was used for this procurement.

title: Security Awareness in Fragile Environments (SAFE) & Close Protection (SAFE+)
description: The FCO (the Authority) is seeking a training Provider to design and deliver a residential training package for its Security Awareness in Fragile Environments (SAFE) courses for staff being deployed to high threat Posts overseas; with an average of 1600 officials per annum participating in the former, and about 1000 on the latter.  The provision of concurrent courses may be appropriate to cater for demand.

title: GB-Bradford: Catering Equipment Maintenance
description:
Contract for the preventative maintenance and reactive repair of catering equipment at the University of Bradford, from March 2020 - March 2021 with the option to extend annually up to March 2025.
      
      For more information about this opportunity, please visit the Delta eSourcing portal at: 
      https://neupc.delta-esourcing.com/tenders/UK-title/UMSHGENN96
      
      Please note that a site visit for Suppliers is being held at 11am on Tuesday 25th February. All Suppliers who are interested in submitting a tender are recommended to attend this visit. Details can be found in the ITT document, and Suppliers should confirm attendance via the Delta portal correspondence function.
      
      Tenders must be submitted electronically via the Delta portal no later than 12 noon Thursday 5th March 2020.

title: Impounding and Immobilisation-Related Services
description: : DVSA is responsible for road safety across the UK and has the powers to either impound or immobilise vehicles. DVSA requires a Supplier to provide services following impounding and immobilisation activity, such as (but not limited to) the collection of vehicle, storage of vehicle and the removal of immobilisation device.

title: Provision of Microwave Digester
description:
Public Health England (PHE) is seeking to procure two (2) automated Microwave digester instrument. 
The ultrawave Microwave digestion system will be used to conduct work under several HPRU work streams, including on-going in-vivo studies on e-cigarette and nanomaterial toxicity. And also for  the de-licensing of nuclear sites through digestion of samples for analysis.


If you feel you can meet all above requirements or would like more information, please contact mercy.mashem@phe.gov.uk before the 21st of February, 2020.

title: Hospital Design and Development Trust Team Procurement for Whipps Cross Hospital Redevelopment Project
description:
Please register and apply through the following e-procurement website  https://www.lppsourcing.org/                                                                          The Hospital Design and Development (HDD) Team will provide a comprehensive management service on
behalf of the Trust to lead and co-ordinate all HDD activities for the completion of the Outline Business Case
(OBC).
 The HDD team will ensure that the OBC deliverables of the HDD workstream are completed in line with
the programme. The key OBC deliverables are included within the Capital Regime, Investment and Property
Business Case Approval Guidance for NHS Trusts and Foundation Trusts (NHS Improvement, 2016). The key
requirements of this workstream are categorised as follows:
• Complete design brief
• RIBA Stage 2 design for the new hospital in line with affordability parameters
• Phasing and decant strategy
• Disposal strategy and valuations for land being released for sale
• Outline planning application for the whole site
• Solutions/option for services moving off site
 Acting as a dedicated team within the Trust's Redevelopment Team, the HDD Team will procure and
manage the advisors and technical design expertise required. They will act client side to coordinate the
inputs of all external consultants to achieve maximum value for money. This will require technical expertise to
oversee the development of the hospital design brief, based on work already produced by the Health and Care
Services Strategy workstream, and manage the design team, ensuring that the new Hospital design and wider
masterplan supports the vision for the Whipps Cross site.
The HDD team will lead the procurement of the following consultants as required by this workstream,
preparing service specifications (where required). They will manage each consultant team to ensure they
discharge their responsibilities and provide high quality outputs in a timely and co-ordinated manner that serves
the Trust's overall interest:
• Architect-led design team to include:
- M&E/Structural/Civil engineers
- Travel and transport consultants
- Health planner
- Masterplanning architect
- CDM-C / Principal Designer
- BREEAM & Sustainability advisor
- Fire advisor
- Equipment advisor
- Town planning advisor
- IT/digital advisor
• Technical surveys including land surveys, asbestos, & infrastructure
• Cost consultant (procured as part of OBC Team)
• Legal advisors for masterplan/HDD matters
• Commercial / valuation property advice
• DQI Facilitator
• Others as required
 The HDD Team will support the HDD Director to manage expenditure of these consultants within an
established budget.
 The HDD Team will support the selection of the preferred option as part of the OBC process and be
responsible for developing the infrastructure plans for the preferred option to RIBA stage 2.
Key OBC Deliverables
3 / 6

Business Case Approval Guidance for NHS Trusts and Foundation Trusts (NHS Improvement, 2016). The key
requirements of this workstream are categorised as follows:

• Outline planning application for the whole site
• Solutions/option for services moving off site

manage the advisors and technical design expertise required. They will act client side to coordinate the
inputs of all external consultants to achieve maximum value for money. This will require technical expertise to
oversee the development of the hospital design brief, based on work already produced by the Health and Care
Services Strategy workstream, and manage the design team, ensuring that the new Hospital design and wider
masterplan supports the vision for the Whipps Cross site.
The HDD team will lead the procurement of the following consultants as required by this workstream,

• Others as required

title: Provision of a Venue Dressing Service
description:
Bury Council is seeking to appoint a suitably qualified and experienced company to provide a venue dressing service to the following establishments
1)	 Elizabethan Suite, Knowsley Street, Bury, BL9 0SW
2)	Longfield Suite, Longfield Centre, Prestwich, Manchester, M25 5AY
3)	Ramsbottom Civic Hall, Market Chambers, Ramsbottom, Bury, BL0 9AJ

Full details of requirements are contained within the tender documentation. The contract is for the period 1st April 2020 to 31st March 2023, with an option to extend the contract for a further 12 months.  
If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity please click on the 'Login and register interest in this opportunity' button. Once you have registered your interest you will be able to access the tender documentation. The closing time for completed tender submissions, via The Chest, is 12 noon on Monday 2nd March 2020.

title: UK-Birmingham: Legal services.
description:
CHIC is a consortium of Registered Providers registered under the Housing & Regeneration Act 2008. It is a registered company incorporated on 25th May 2010 under company number 07266506. It currently has around 90 members, although it should be noted that some of the members are groups of housing providers. Details of members can be found at http://www.chicltd.co.uk/.
      The Members intend to appoint suppliers to each Lot capable of providing high-quality commercial and practical legal advice and assisting Members to reduce their legal spend. It is an objective of this tender that the Members will achieve better value, enhanced service delivery and more efficient management of matters outsourced to external solicitors.

title: WHHT - Acute Redevelopment Programme Next Phase Technical Support (LPP/2017/001)
description:
Contract for Acute Redevelopment Programme Next Phase Technical Support at West Hertfordshire Hospitals NHS Trust (WHHT).

The Trust has a small internal programme team in place currently and has plans to expand in house capacity and capability over the next 3 - 6 months and during the lifetime of the programme.

However significant external expertise and project management capacity is required to support the outline and full business case and delivery stages of the redevelopment programme. 

The Trust sought to establish a non-exclusive call off contract with an expert advisory partner to support the next phase of planning and to scope required tasks. The expert partner will provide flexible professional programme management and estates advisory support, working in partnership with the Trust to ensure that the programme is delivered in line with expected timeframes utilising an appropriately robust programme methodology for a development of this scale. 

Given the range and scale of support expected to be required the selected partner may need to operate as a lead provider with access to a supply chain of specialist advisors, appropriately procured to give assurance of value for money and quality delivery. 

A mini competition has been run under the LPP Estates Professional Services Dynamic Purchasing System.

title: ITT For The Provision Of Quantity Surveyor Services
description:
The proposed works comprise of (in part) the refurbishment of RBH housing stock approximately 12,800 homes of mixed tenure to comply with Decent Homes Standards and include replacement windows and doors, replacement kitchens and bathrooms, replacement heating and re-wiring, environmental improvement works and other major improvements. The works will comprise of individual 'mini-projects' ranging in value between £20,000 and £1,300,000 and for the purpose of the fee proposal the Consultant will provide Quantity Surveying services to all projects, including the validation of project costs for works completed by the in-house contracting team.

tender documents are available to download from 
www.the-chest.org.uk

title: Temporary traffic management arrangements
description: The appointed contractor will provide assistance and advice to the client with regards to temporary traffic management arrangements of work promoters associated with street works, road works and events that affect the highway network of the London borough of Enfield. This will include: • Attending on-site and office based meetings with stakeholders on large scale traffic management projects • Providing analytical data on traffic impacts and potential traffic congestion and projections of disruption on the Enfield highway network and any neighbouring borough that is affected. • Reviewing traffic management plans and advising on suitability and compliance with statutory regulations and Codes. • Making recommendations on Traffic Management proposals. • Provide assistance to the client on related projects as and when agreed by both parties.

title: Restorative Justice Services
description:
The PCC for Merseyside is allocated grant funding by the Ministry of Justice (MoJ) for victims' services. The funding is anticipated to continue into 2020/21, although the level of funding will not be confirmed prior to the commencement of this tendering process. The grant will be issued to commission and/or provide and develop victims' support services, including Restorative Justice (RJ), for Merseyside. 
Restorative Justice (RJ) is the process of bringing together victims with those responsible for the harm, to find a positive way forward.  It can provide a means of closure and enable the victim to move on.  RJ also provides an opportunity for offenders to face the consequences of their actions, recognise the impact that it has had upon others and, where possible make amends. In this way, RJ has the potential to help rehabilitate offenders and enable them to stop offending.

title: Board Effectiveness Review
description:
The purpose of this project is to undertake a review of Board effectiveness and the effectiveness of the Audit and Risk Assurance Committee (ARAC) and the Remuneration and People Committee (RemCo) as the principal active Board Committees. 
We carried out effectiveness reviews of the Board and ARAC in March 2017, and RemCo in January 2018. We also stated in our 2017-18 Annual Report and Accounts that the Board regularly reviews its effectiveness, and that we intend to undertake another formal assessment in 2018-19, once the new Board members and the Chief Executive are established. In November and December 2018, Board members are completing questionnaires about Board effectiveness. This process is taking place alongside the individual performance appraisals that are being carried out by the Chair.
We did not carry out effectiveness reviews of the other Board committees during 2017 or 2018. This decision was made because the Thames Tideway Tunnel Committee, the Casework Committee and the Nominations and Governance Committee generally only meet when required and at that time were not having to meet regularly or at all. We are not currently proposing to carry out formal effectiveness reviews of these committees.
Requirements
Overall Objectives of Project
The overall objectives of the project are to:
•	Test the Board's role in setting and monitoring the strategy and direction of Ofwat, including how the Board utilises the Ofwat strategy to drive its activities and how it monitors implementation; 
•	Evaluate how the Board fulfils its advisory, challenge and support role in relation to the Executive, 
•	Consider the dynamics and functioning of the Board and committees, including: 
o	considering where the Board focusses their time by reference to the above roles and objectives,
o	understanding whether the Board and committees work cohesively and members are effective as a team, 
o	considering the interactions and communication with Chief Executive, Executive Directors and other senior executives,
o	testing the cohesiveness and the quality of participation in Board meetings;
•	Consider the quality of information available to the Board and committees and the quality of the support infrastructure; and
•	Consider the mechanisms for the selection process for new board members (SoS makes appointments), and succession planning, in particular to consider how best to approach recruitment to ensure an appropriate spread of skills and diversity, including of experience; and
•	Recommendations to address areas identified for improvement.

title: WSCC Hospital Discharge Care Service - AWARD
description:
A Contract for the provision of a Hospital Discharge Care Service is being tendered by West Sussex County Council. Full details of the services can be found in Document 02 the Service Specification.
      
      The Council has scheduled a Bidders' Briefing session as detailed below. 
      
      All Bidders are recommended to attend; however, attendance is optional. The presentation and any questions and responses provided on the day will be uploaded to the e-Sourcing portal once the session is complete.
      
      BIDDER'S BRIEFING
      Date: Wednesday 6th November 2019
      Time: Please note that the event will start promptly at 2pm
      Location: Committee Room 3, County Hall.
      Bidders are asked to report to Main Reception, County Hall, West Street, Chichester, PO19 1RG where they will be met by a member of the team.
      Please note there is no on-site parking available. Local parking information can be found at https://www.chichester.gov.uk/parking
      Content: 
      o Overview of the requirements
      o Explanation of the process
      o Q & A
      o Using the WSCC e-Sourcing Portal
      RSVP: Please send a message on the e-Sourcing Portal by Tuesday 5th November 2019 and advise who from your organisation will be attending.

title: Delivered Ready Prepared Meals 2020
description:
NHS Supply Chain: food, seeked to establish a non-exclusive Framework Agreement for supply and delivery to the NHS Supply Chain customer base via the direct/e-Direct route of chilled and/or frozen meals in 2 lots. The Framework Agreement will have an initial term of 24 months with an option to extend incrementally for up to a total period of a further 24 months (i.e. 48 months in total). It is anticipated that in the first 12 months of the Framework Agreement the value of purchases will be in the region of 14 700 000 GBP. For the full 48 month term (if extended) the anticipated value is in the region of 147 000 000 GBP. These values are approximate only
and are based on the most recent historical usage information, with a forecasted level of growth. The values provided are for guidance only and are not a guarantee of business.

title: North East Essex Diabetes Service (NEEDS)
description:
NHS North East Essex Clinical Commissioning Group (NEECCG) will shortly be engaging with a third party organisation whom will be undertaking an independent review of Diabetes Management (DM) services across the Suffolk and North East Essex Integrated Care System (ICS).
The outcomes of the review will inform the commercial options for the future of Diabetes services across the ICS, including North East Essex.
The review is expected to be completed by April 2020 after which partners across the ICS will convene to deliberate its recommendations, commence action planning and explore commissioning options and opportunities; a process NECCG anticipate will take 2-3 months. To enable this process NEECCG will extend the current North East Essex Diabetes Service (NEEDS) by 12 months to 31st March 2022.
Recommendations from this review will inform the future commissioning of services and its potential geography.

The overall aim of the current NEEDS is to co-ordinate, promote and ensure, via a single point of access, the provision of a comprehensive range of high quality, cost effective integrated health services for people with diabetes and their carers living in North East Essex.

The current contract is due to expire on 31st March 2021.

The additional contractual term is for a period of 12 months from 1st April 2021 to 31st March 2022.
This will enable project team at NEECCG to be able to fully explore the options within the wider system and to understand if the service could be expanded into other areas.

A voluntary ex ante transparency notice relating to this matter was published on 27.1.2020.

title: Alderbury Village Hall Extension
description:
Alderbury Village Hall Extension

Alderbury Parish Council, as the owner of the Alderbury Village Hall and the adjacent Recreation Ground located on Southampton Road in the centre of the village of Alderbury, Salisbury, is seeking tender bids for the following works:

•	An extension to the rear (South West) of the Village Hall and Social Club, approximately 23.6m x 5m, including the provision of a meeting room, new kitchen for the Social Club, a treatment room, a toilet and storage,
•	An infill extension between the existing dressing room and toilet block on the South East elevation of the Village Hall, approximately 13m x 2.8m,
•	Improvements to the Village Hall kitchen,
•	Improvement in the appearance of the buildings through render, cladding and new windows.

Please note the following requirements of tendering contractors:

•	The contractor must be able to demonstrate successful completion of previous projects of a similar nature. Case studies and testimonials are also welcomed.

•	The contractor must provide a current Public Liability Insurance certificate.


For further information and tender documentation, please apply to:

Barclay and Phillips Architects
Caroline Everett 
Office Manager
The Studio
Unit 5 Oakridge Business Park
Whaddon
Wiltshire
SP5 3HT

caroline@barclay-phillips.co.uk
01722 711177

title: PQ0239 - Technical PFI capital projects contract management
description:
The Council requires a supplier for the provision of Technical PFI capital projects contract management services.
      
      Birmingham City Council (BCC) has 4 PFI schools contracts incorporating 28 Schools/Academies.  The contracts relate to design, build, finance and operate contractual agreements and are in place for between 25 to 35 years from commissioning:
      
      - PPP1 - Birmingham Schools Partnership Limited - contract was signed in February 2000 and there are circa 15 years remaining of the operate phase.
      - PPP2 - Transform Schools - contract was signed in March 2006 and there are circa 16 years remaining of the operate phase. 
      - BSF Phase 1a - Birmingham Lend Lease Partnership (BLLP) - contracts were signed in August 2009 and there are 19 years remaining of the operate phase.
      - BSF Phase 1b - Birmingham Lend Lease Partnership (BLLP) - contracts were signed in August 2011 and there are 18 years remaining of the operate phase.
      
      The proposed commission is to provide Birmingham City Council (BCC) with technical and contractual advice and, where required, project management support, relating to the need to adapt, develop and / or construct School estate to meet the increasing requirement for school pupil placements across a number of the PFI sites. 
      
      There is a requirement to: 
      
      - Prioritisation and evaluation of projects including ongoing live activities and PFI negotiations.
      - Analysis of impact on the PFI including maximising the effectiveness of the sites
      - Following detailed review with Schools, BCC and SPV, submittal of variations in line with contract and project requirements 
      - Interrogate, respond to and close out any SPV, SPV Lawyers, Funders Representatives and Sub-contractors' correspondence
      - Undertake financial and contractual evaluation around Conditions & Costs proposed by the SPV partners, as part of facilitation 
      - Represent and support BCC during negotiation with SPV and provide project Risk Assessments / Matrix for Contractor to work to
      - Delivery Phase - Facilitate works to be delivered in line with project requirements and costs; attend project meetings
      - Support BCC delivery vehicle, provide expert advice during Commissioning Period
      - Provide technical advice and negotiation to ensure PFI contractual integrity is captured and restored post completion.
      
      The Council will be using its free to use e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and potential suppliers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity please click on the following link to access https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register. You will then be sent details on how to log on which will enable you to download all relevant quotation documentation.  
      
      If you are unable to register with In-tend or have any questions or problems on how to use this web site p...

title: GB-Lowestoft: DA- Artificial Sea Water System
description: The requirement is for a system for producing high quality artificial seawater with minimal staff input. 1.Water softening, dechlorination and RO production system to fill 200 L water holding and mixing tank for producing artificial seawater with ability to measure water quality (salinity, temperature and pH), plus 2x 200L circulating UV treated water storage tanks with taps.

title: Health and Social Care Related Joint Equipment Store
description: Southampton City Council and Portsmouth City Council along with their respective health Partners Southampton City Clinical Commissioning Group and Portsmouth Clinical Commissioning Group seek to appoint a service provider to deliver a Joint Equipment Service (JES) for the loan of health related equipment to adults and children within the boundaries of Southampton and Portsmouth or those located outside of the boundaries of the Local authority but who are registered with a GP practice within one of the two cities.

title: Provision of Home to School Transport in the Kendal area (T5712)
description:
Tenders are invited for the provision of passenger transport services by taxi, minibus and/or coach in relation to Home to School in the Kendal area

The minimum number of seats required is 4 (No passenger assistant required)

You must refer to the "Instructions for Tendering" prior to submitting your bid. 

All submissions must be uploaded and returned via the Chest 

The documents that must be included in your submission are:
		
		Information and Declaration
		Tender Pricing Submission 
		Daily timetable template 

The deadline for submission is:

10:00 Wednesday 19 February 2020


PLEASE ENSURE YOU HAVE UPLOADED ALL THE REQUIRED DOCUMENTS AS FAILURE TO DO SO MAY RESULT IN YOUR TENDER SUBMISSION NOT BEING CONSIDERED

title: Growth Service for Businesses in Cambridgeshire & Peterborough
description:
The contract is to appoint a single company or prime contractor/ consortia type arrangement to support the CPCA in delivering the Local Industrial Strategy by way of four specific areas of growth.  

These include:
An Inclusive Growth Service, 
to engage our highest potential growth firms to better support them to accelerate their growth, increase their capacity and capability for growth, sustain their period within growth, or all three. 

An Inward Investment Service, 
to extend our reach into key global markets, to engage and persuade overseas firms to locate into our economy or invest in our strategic projects to increase our employment space, develop our transport infrastructure or establish a new university.

A Skills Service, 
to provide an effective brokerage between young talent and those retraining or progressing in a career, our employers and our skills providers, to improve the supply of skills to enable growth. 

A Capital or Innovation & Re-Location Grant 
to co-invest with small firms in the cost of contracting experts to help;
 - to fund all businesses, especially traditional firms, to grow through organic expansion, paying for equipment and expanding premises
 - to provide access to R&D funding from UK and EU agencies for new product growth and increased productivity
 - to provide access to fast-track planning, partners and investment for new build employment space  

These service will be delivered in each of our three sub-economies in a tailored manner to better spread growth more evenly across our total economy.
