title: Supervised Contact
description:
The London Borough of Lambeth is looking to invite eligible bidders for the provision of supervised contact services for families of children and young people looked after up to age 18. The service will support and promote beneficial, safeguarded contact with families of children and young people .
The contract will be let for an initial 2 years commencing September 2020 with an option to extend for 2 years on an annual basis.

Bidders must demonstrate its ability to:
• Provide a high quality workforce to meet the needs of the service
• Develop a good working relationship with Lambeth's Children Care
• Work in partnership with Lambeth children's social care
• Support the development of the service.

In order to submit an expression interest please register your organisation through the link where Tender documents can be accessed

title: Floor Coverings
description:
The North Eastern Universities Purchasing Consortia (NEUPC) are leading on a process to award a framework for floor coverings. The scope is to include primary and secondary entrance matting, carpet tile, broadloom carpet, roll vinyl, safety vinyl, acoustic vinyl, vinyl tile, linoleum, static control flooring, rubber flooring and laminate flooring. The framework is going to be available to all members of NEUPC, as well as all members of  LUPC, SUPC, HEPCW and NWUPC.
      
      The tender will be split into lots, with opportunities to bid for supply only or supply, fit & maintenance.

title: Employee Engagement
description:
The purpose of this procurement is to procure expertise and research to support CITB's programme of Employee Engagement from 2020 to 2024.
      It is anticipated that this research will take the form of initial survey design planning, with a full census employee survey undertaken every 6 months:
      
      •2020 - Initial survey design planning followed by 2x CITB census employee surveys - results from survey 1 available for end March 2020, results from survey 2 available for end August 2020
      •2021 - Dip survey for end March 2021, CITB census survey end August 2021
      •2022 - Dip survey for end March 2022, CITB census survey end August 2022
      •2023 - Dip survey for end March 2023, CITB census survey end August 2023
      •2024 - Dip survey for end March 2024, CITB census survey end August 2024

title: RA279950 - 0AR - Web Based Medicines Optimisation Service
description:
You are invited to submit a quotation on behalf of NHS North of England CSU for Procurement of Web Based Medicines Optimisation Service under NHS Terms and Conditions. - The deadline for clarification questions is 02/03/2020 at 11.30am
Responses to the clarification questions will be sent out, no later than 48 hours after the deadline.
State delivery lead time, all price to be stated on Multiquote and Bid Response Net VAT - To access this competition: login to https://suppliers.multiquote.com and view the opportunity RA279950. Not registered on MultiQuote - visit https://suppliers.multiquote.com then register and quote RA279950 as the reason for registration. Any queries please contact MultiQuote on 0151 482 9230.

title: Hardie, Ogden & Webb
description:
Property Address's - Flats 1-8 Hardie House, Swift Road, Flats 1-24 Ogden House, Flats 1-16 Webb House, Swift Road, Hanworth, Feltham TW13

 Scaffolding for access, works to be carried out are window and door replacement and associated works.

 New PVCu window installation; new communal door and access control replacement; new canopy covering replacement liquid system to all canopies with 20-year guarantee; new mechanical extract ventilation to kitchens and bathrooms with new electrical spurs and certification; new rainwater goods; CCTV drainage surveys and external redecoration to all previously painted surfaces subject to survey. Provisional repairs subject to surveys for gulley replacement; concrete lintel repairs and fascia and soffit boards.

title: Environment Agency - Mindfulness App
description:
We believe brilliant things happen with Calm Minds. Our aim is to support our colleagues by providing access to a mindfulness app that provides us with business information on its use and engagement. By making mindfulness apps available to those that would benefit from using it most we aim to improve our workplace through increased productivity, improved focus, greater collaboration between colleagues, reduce absenteeism and improve people's personal resilience and wellbeing. 

Since December 2018, the environment agency has undertaken over 31,000 mindfulness sessions for over 4400 hours of use of a mindfulness app. These sessions have had a direct benefit of improving general wellbeing, reducing the feeling of stress and anxiety at home and work for those colleagues. We wish to provide this service to 1500 employees for a 12 month period, starting in April 2020.
buyer: DEPARTMENT FOR ENVIRONMENT FOOD & RURAL AFFAIRS

title: C17680 - Loadline Inspection and Docking - HMC Valiant
description:
Border Force (BF) is a Directorate of the Home Office. BF operate a fleet of five (5) Cutters. One of these Cutters, HMC Valiant (4207 Class), has a requirement for a period of dry docking to include; Loadline Inspection and some general maintenance.
The full package of works required is detailed in the attached Statement of Requirements (SoR) - C17680 - SoR - HMC Valiant - LLID - vf.
Following this sourcing exercise based on written quotation, this contract will commence on the 16th March 2020. Upon successful acceptance of HMC Valiant by the supplier, the work package is required to be undertaken between 16th March 2020 and 6th April 2020 in line with the Cutters' operational working pattern. 
It is a critical requirement that this package is to be undertaken in the following geographic area; 
1.	Europe (Eastern Mediterranean) - Pireas, Perama or Salamina, Greece.
Bidders are required to submit their written quotations in both .pdf and .docx formats.
The purpose of this notice is to make the SoR available to, and invite, potential suppliers to confirm they can fully meet the requirements by providing a fully itemised written quotation for the complete and specified work package. The quotation is to be submitted in currency, EURO.
Those potential suppliers are invited to send an email to; Ian McDermott, Home Office Commercial at Ian.Mcdermott@homeoffice.gov.uk , confirming their interest in this opportunity, providing the itemised quotation, in addition to confirmation of yard availability over the stated dates. Furthermore, confirmation of agreement to the Home Office Standard Short Form Services Terms and Conditions (C17680 - T&Cs - HMC Valiant - LLID) on which the contract will be awarded is required.
Quotations should also be accompanied by a Cardinal Date Plan (CDP) as stated in the SoR, section 5.6. All required documentation should be submitted via email to Ian McDermott, at the address above, no later than: 1200hrs GMT, Monday 2nd March 2020.

title: Framework Agreement for Engineering Inspections
description:
This framework is to appoint a single Contractor to deliver engineering inspections for Durham County Council in line with statutory requirements.
This Contract will cover the provision of engineering inspections for plant and equipment to ensure compliance with current Regulations, This Contract includes a requirement for an initial audit of properties and equipment to enable the creation of an accurate asset database to facilitate the contract and effective maintenance. The contract is to cover a wide and diverse range of properties, including office accommodation, public buildings, educational establishments, leisure facilities, fire and rescue stations and domestic properties of vulnerable people. The Council reserves the right to add additional areas on throughout the duration of the contract including any extensions taken.

title: Design Consultant for Hebburn Minewater Energy Scheme
description:
South Tyneside Council seek to appoint a mechanical, electrical and civil design contractor to develop a detailed design of a £7m district energy infrastructure at Hebburn Town centre using innovative low carbon heat sources including mine water source heat pump and combined heat and power plant.

The works comprise the design, layout, specification and detailing of process lines, operating equipment and building services of a district energy infrastructure including the development an energy centre and connections to existing buildings in Hebburn Town centre for both heat and power supply.

The contract shall be split in two phases, one to RIBA stage 3 for concept and validation of initial calculations including topographical, GPR and any other surveys required and permissions (planning advice initially), with the second a detailed design phase including planning, additional surveys and construction tender documents.

Construction phase support is also required.
Part 1 - April - October 2020
Part 2 (Dependant on scheme viability) - November 2020 until entire project completion, estimated to be December 2022.

The Council reserves the right to award the contract through a wholly owned subsidiary or to novate the contract to such a subsidiary if it is appropriate to do so in order to facilitate the operation of the scheme.

Suppliers are required to express interest in this opportunity on the NEPO ProContract system. If not already registered on ProContract please register at the following link: https://procontract.due-north.com. Suppliers will then be granted access to the tender documentation.

Please note that registering on ProContract and expressing interest does not mean that you have bid for the tender - once the above steps are complete you will be required to complete and submit the tender documents.

title: Provision of Replacement Cycle Track at Charity Brook Park, Davies Road, Evesham
description:
Wychavon District Council is inviting bids for the provision of a replacement cycle track at Charity Brook Park. Charity Brook Park is a small local park located on Davies Road, Evesham WR11 2AS. 

The cycle track on site is situated in a small wooded area in the Park next to the play area and adjacent to the Battleton Brook water course. The cycle track in situ has been closed off due to the breakdown of the existing timber structure and surfacing. 

The Council is using the e-procurement portal known as the Proactis Pro-Contract portal https://procontract.due-north.com to conduct this procurement exercise.

To gain access to the procurement documents, contractors will need to register their company details at the above website. Once registered, contractors will be emailed a log-in and password which will allow them to gain access to the procurement documents. Contractors will need to search for the invitation under Wychavon District Council and then electronically submit an expression of interest and follow the online instructions to view the procurement documents.

title: Supply of Interim Call Off Printing Services for the UKHO
description: These are interim call off contracts arrangements for six months duration (with option to extend by up to a further six months), for printing and finishing services, for the UKHO. These contracts are being set up, as part of business critical strategies being put in place by the UKHO, following its previous key printing and supplier going into administration, in late 2019. These contracts are also being put in place to provide the UKHO with the period and opportunity to be able to re-compete the full publication printing, finishing and fulfilment services.

title: 20-07 Modernisation of a Dartec 20 kN Servo Hydraulic Test Frame
description:
The University of Wolverhampton has been part funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) to deliver a Composites & Additive Layer Materials Engineering Research & Innovation Centre (CALMERIC) in the Marches, Stoke-on-Trent & Staffordshire and Greater Birmingham & Solihull Local Economic Partnership (LEP) areas. 

The CALMERIC project supports SME's to conduct collaborative research and innovation projects in the field of advanced engineering materials with specialist staff based in the Centre established on Telford Innovation Campus of the University of Wolverhampton. In order to compliment and add to the University's facilities, the project requires modernisation of a Dartec Fatigue Testing rig located at the Telford campus.

title: 324F_20 Cash Collection and Cash & Valuables in Transit Services - Re Tender
description:
ESPO on behalf of ESPO and YPO is seeking to establish a national framework agreement that will cover the collection, processing, consolidation and onward depositing of money / valuables from customers' premises and car parks to nominated cash receiving facilities or other suitable receiving locations.   All Tenderers must meet the minimum mandatory specification stated in the Invitation to Tender document.

Lot 1: Cash Collection and Cash & Valuables in Transit Services - Additional products and services that customers may require during the life of the framework include (but are not limited to):
-same day deposit services
-collection and replenishment of ticket vending machines
-bus and tram collections
-secure transportation of sensitive data and other valuables
-ad-hoc cash collections and float deliveries for events and exhibitions
-charity boxes collections
-cash float services for replenishment of ATM cassettes
-depositing of cash to High Street banks
-purchase, delivery and installation of standard and smart safes
-end to end cash management services
The requirement is split into 12 regional areas as follows:
East Midlands; East of England; North East England; North West England; South East England; South West England; West Midlands; Yorkshire & Humber; London; Scotland; Wales; and Northern Ireland.
Tenderers' can apply for one, some or all regional areas.

The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 24 months. The total estimated value stated includes the option period.

An eAuction process may be used to award subsequent call off contracts following the reopening of competition among the parties to the Framework Agreement.

title: Provision of Leadership Development Centres (NFCC Leadership Framework)
description:
The GMCA are seeking to introduce the National Fire Chiefs Councils (NFCC) Leadership Framework, which will require significant and targeted investment in leaders at all levels, increasing capability and developing self-awareness. 

To achieve this objective we are planning to hold development centres, with an emphasis on supporting individuals by helping them to understand how their role can contribute to the Services Strategic agenda, as well as providing them with the necessary tools and techniques to be successful leaders. In addition to this, the Service is keen to understand the existing management capabilities, which in turn will inform future learning and development requirements and succession planning.

Our ambition is to deliver the development centres over a relatively short period, ideally by the end of January 2020 and certainly before the end of the financial year. This challenging timeframe coupled with limited internal resource, means that we will need to secure external resource and we are therefore seeking a trusted partner to work with us.                                                                                                                                                                                                         In accordance with the GMCA Constitution and Procurement Rules, this opportunity is being conducted under our RFQ rules and as such is not an open competition, it will be open to the invited list of selected suppliers only.

title: GB-London: Online Safety Technology - Sectoral Analysis 2019
description:
Research services. The Department for Digital, Culture, Media & Sport (DCMS) and the Home Office jointly published the Online Harms White Paper (OHWP) in April 2019 setting out government's proposals for regulation and policies to tackle harms taking place online. The government is currently evaluating consultation responses to the proposals set out in the White Paper and is due to publish its response to the consultation by the end of 2019.
DCMS is seeking to appoint a provider to:

Undertake research into the commercial market for products and services relating to online safety in the UK;

Conduct an analysis of how the market has developed, key trends, and strengths and weaknesses in this market; and 

Evaluate how the commercial market relates to the wider innovation ecosystem around online harms. 

Together with DCMS analysis of consultation responses and findings from our stakeholder engagement, this research will feed into the government's response to the consultation, and our programme of activity to support and grow the UK's online safety sector and ecosystem.
buyer: Department for Digital, Culture, Media  and Sport

title: OG - Creative Design Agency Framework - PP989
description:
Orbit is seeking to appoint preferred suppliers by Lot to enter into a framework contract to provide Creative Design Agency Services across Orbit Group as specified in the accompanying documents. We seek service providers with the ability to transform our marketing and design briefs into innovative engagement which will help convey recognition of the Orbit brand. This will require any supplier to have knowledge of our audiences and customer base and how a Registered Social Housing Provider works. To meet the varied requirements Orbit is establishing a multi-provider framework agreement which will be divided into (3) three Lots as indicated follows:
•	Creative and conceptual design - Customer and Corporate Communication and Marketing 
•	Digital communication and marketing 
•	Creative Design and art working
This tender opportunity is being run via ProContract, suppliers can register for free at www.housingprocurement.com. All communication must be via this portal.

title: ITT: Ainley Salt Barn and Ancillary Works
description:
The project objectives for this commission are to: • Undertake works to construct the new Salt Barn with the Ainley Depot in readiness for 2020/2021 Winter Maintenance period (1st October 2020 - 30th April 2021). The works are, but not limited to: Site Clearance • Removal/recycling of existing concrete slab. • Isolation and removal of existing lighting columns. Salt Barn Building • All works in association with the design, supply, erection and commissioning of the new Salt Barn Building including all ancillary works including design and construction of;- retaining walls, foundations, concrete slab drainage connections, slot drain, ramped access, salt bund protection measures, above surface drainage, ducting, internal & external LED lighting and connections. We expect the value of this project to be within the region of £400,000 - £750,000.To view documentation please go to:
https://procontract.due-north.com/ProjectManagement/ProjectDashboard?projectId=69a95114-be20-ea11-80fc-005056b64545

title: Longford Court  Replacement Boiler Room Plant
description:
Medway Council wish to appoint an experience and professional contractor to undertake the boiler and hot water cylinder replacement works at Longford Court.

The contract is expect to run from the 1st June 2020 to 3rd September 2020.

title: Grounds Maintenance Yorkshire
description:
This opportunity is published in full on the Proactis (formerly Due North) ProContract portal as project DN458092. Registration on ProContract is free of charge. Accent Housing Ltd will not respond to any contact or communication which is not made through the ProContract messaging platform. Any emails sent directly to
Accent Housing Ltd will be deleted unread and telephone calls declined.
In order to support delivery of its corporate strategy in an efficient manner, Accent seeks 2 contractor(s) to deliver high-quality comprehensive grounds maintenance services across 2 lots of roughly equal size and value in Yorkshire.
The successful contractors will have demonstrable experience and a proven track record of providing high quality grounds maintenance services.
For the avoidance of doubt we will only consider contractor(s) who either already have, or are willing to establish a base of operations no more than 20 miles from any of sites within the lot(s) being bid for. This geographic requirement is justified to respond effectively in the event of inclement weather, for example for snow  clearing services.
streetaddress: Charlestown House, Acorn Park Industrial Estate Charlestown

title: Provision of MapInfo Professional Licences Support & Maintenance
description:
The Council currently uses MapInfo as its main GIS (Geographic Information System). This is used for data capture, storage, presentation and analysis and modelling among other functions. The current licences are concurrent and the desktop installations are currently as mix of v12 and v17 as users progress with the migration. These licences are due to expire at the end of March 2020.
The Council wants to ensure that it can upgrade users to the latest versions of MapInfo as and when released.

title: Development Contractors Framework
description: Red Kite is a tenant-led, not-for-profit, charitable housing association. As a major provider of social housing in High Wycombe and the surrounding areas, it currently owns and manages circa 6,700 properties and holds a modest land portfolio.Red Kite has embarked on an ambitious development programme to provide at least 375 new homes by 2023 to support the delivery of much needed housing, with an aspiration to deliver up to 500. Red Kite's plan is to build a range of different tenures which will include a small number of outright sale homes but the main focus is to deliver affordable rented homes.To deliver its programme, Red Kite Community Housing Limited (as a central purchasing body on behalf of itself and any of its current or future group entities and subsidiaries) wishes to establish a multi-supplier framework of contractors for the construction of new homes in and around the Wycombe area.
streetaddress: Windsor Court, Kingsmead Business Park, Frederick Place

title: Design and Development of Websites, Portals and Ecommerce
description: Johnnie Johnson Housing (JJH) and Astraline would like to invite proposals for the complete redesign, refresh and relaunch our two company websites. Since their most recent design updates in 2016 our brand and corporate strategy has continued to develop and is now in a significantly different place.With this project we wish to address and close that gap, and create two contemporary, intuitive sites that position us as market maker in our sector, so that we can support existing and attract future residents and customers. We require the website to be fully responsive across mobile devices and include tracking data and goals for google analytics, Facebook pixel etc. It should comply with all current usability and accessibility standards. Improving the customer experience is paramount to the successful delivery and impact of this project.

title: ITQ-NUR-0120-391 Intervention to enhance positive practice environments
description:
This procurement is to secure the services of a suitably qualified academic organisation to deliver an existing evidence-based intervention designed to develop local leadership skills and behaviours to support wards and organisations to build sustainable, positive environments for staff and patients. We need to test the transferability of an existing evidence-based intervention which has been developed in the acute sector, in other healthcare settings (e.g. mental health) to enhance our understanding about the opportunities for developing a positive practice environment and associated improved outcomes.
The invitation to quote is specifically looking for organisations (likely to be a Higher Education Institute) to submit an application outlining how an existing evidence-based intervention can be tested in a new setting to explore transferability. Through supporting the spread of this intervention rather than investing in developing a new piece of work in the same area, it is anticipated it can enhance the key national priorities outlined above as well as impact of the existing intervention by truly exploring the intricacies of  what works to improve culture and engage staff. It also allows us to test the sustainability of an existing model which can prove difficult in an ever-changing health and social care climate.

title: Weybridge Masterpan OBC - Cost Support
description:
Continuation of costing support from RLB as follows:
-	Update of Option 2B / 3B Cost Plans as required 
-	Attendance of Meetings to review revisions of design to provide cost advise
-	Review / Preparation of Cashflow forecasts 
-	Review of designs for In Vivo / In Vitro that Arup are planning to update at high level to provide costing advise
-	Review and Amendment to Opex costing for current Options 2B / 3B

title: Occupational Health Cognitive Behavioural Therapy Services
description:
The City of London Corporation and COLP are seeking tenders for the provision of Cognitive Behavioural Therapist services to provide psychological assessments, rehabilitation programmes and post incident support including the delivery of trauma focused CBT and Eye Movement Desensitisation Reprogramming (EMDR). The purpose of the service is to both improve attendance management and provide support for people to remain at or getting back to work in an optimum functional capacity as soon as reasonably possible. The OH service is looking to develop the Cognitive Behavioural Therapist role exploring ways to actively engage management in supporting rehabilitation.

For further information, please access the tender on Capital e-Sourcing portal:
https://www.capitalesourcing.com/web/login.shtml

title: Transforming IWM London Phase 2 Basebuild Principal Contractor Works
description: The Contractor will be creating shells for the new Second World War Gallery (SWWG) and new The Holocaust Gallery (THG), two fully fitted-out learning spaces on Level 1 and Level 2 of the Museum, upgrading the HVAC services to a storage area on Level 2 and a refurbished toilet block, also on Level 2 of the Museum.At present, the works are scheduled to run from January 2019 until December 2020. Timeframes and completion dates for specific sections within that period will vary.

title: Preferred supplier list for Strategic Communications and Engagement Recruitment
description: Two recruitment lots - one for each function - are available. An agency can confirm they meet the requirements of one or both lots. They will be expected to demonstrate how they can supply candidates in all the locations specified, recognising the directorate has people based in all four UK nations.LOT 1: PUBLIC AFFAIRS AND EXTERNAL RELATIONS rolesThe agency will supply candidates for permanent, fixed term and temporary roles in London, Manchester, other England locations, Edinburgh, Cardiff and Belfast.LOT 2: COMMUNICATIONS, DIGITAL AND MARKETING rolesThe agency will supply candidates for permanent, fixed term and temporary roles in London and Manchester.

title: Luton Council Reablement and Care Plan Solution
description:
****  ADVERT HAS CEASED 24.4.20 DUE TO A OVERWHELMING RESPONSE  ****   RE MINI TENDER BELOW OJEU : Luton Council has a requirement to provide a mobile Reablement service to the community along with other services such as Extra Care. In outline: For Reablement this includes sending care workers to residents homes, servicing their care needs, updating records at the point of each visit, reallocating the repeat care requirement into a roster system, this will ensure that regardless of any resource issues the resident is always programmed to receive a visit from a carer and that up to date information of the persons care requirements including taking of prescribed drugs is always available to any member of the care team who have been allocated the work. This is an in-house service provision to Luton Council and as such it needs to operate as a business, therefore any solution providing tool to assist in the running of an efficient business will be considered.  The Reablement Service, part of Intermediate Care has a workforce of approx. 70 field based support workers, coordinated by a team of 11 office based employees.
Luton Council current solution for rostering and a care planning software tool is Staffplan with Iconnect providing the mobile handset solution. The current versions of both Staffplan and Iconnect are not only outdated with limited functionality but also lack the ability to integrate with other systems within LBC such as Liquid Logic and ITrent. Current solution user areas include the Reablement Team: 11 - office based / 80 mobile based (10 headroom) and the Extra Care Team: 4 - office based with a potential 24 mobile based (TBC - with head room).  The Extra Care staff team work in 3 separate courts where individuals that they support have their own flats within that building. The service is covered by staff 24/7 the carers work shift patterns of mornings, afternoons and waking night shifts. The teams make up about 17 carers per court with a maximum of 5 carers working on one shift. Extra Care staff visit residents in their own homes, deliver care tailored to the resident's needs, updating records on each visit, using a rostering system that plans residents visits

title: Energy Brokerage Services
description:
Procurement Assist Limited is seeking service providers to take part in tendering for a place on a 60 month Dynamic Purchasing System for Energy Brokerage Services.
      
      The DPS will be available for use by iFM Bolton and the whole public sector from across the United Kingdom.  The DPS initial application period is 30 days but will remain open until 31 May 2025.  Applications from service providers can be made at any time during this period.
      The DPS is intended to be a fast route to market for Clients, with Clients not needing any further engagement with OJEU procurement processes.
buyer: Procurement Assist Limited c/o Integrated Facilities Management Bolton Ltd (iFM Bolton)

title: Telecommunications
description:
Procurement Assist Limited is seeking service providers to take part in tendering for a place on a 60 month Dynamic Purchasing System for Telecommunications Services.
      
      The services will be split into 4 Categories, as follows:
      
      Category 1: Mobile Telecommunications
      Category 2: Traditional Telephony and IP Telephony
      Category 3: Connectivity
      Category 4: Total Telecoms Solution
      
      The DPS will be available for use by iFM Bolton and the whole public sector from across the United Kingdom.  The DPS initial application period is 30 days but will remain open until 31 May 2025.  Applications from service providers can be made at any time during this period.
      The DPS is intended to be a fast route to market for Clients, with Clients not needing any further engagement with OJEU procurement processes.

title: GB-London: Understanding the barriers and enablers to applying rules and standards changes
description: This research aims to determine a clear rules assurance process and improve industry understanding of how the benefits of a rule change may be fully realised. It will facilitate consistent adoption of performance enabling rules across the industry. This project will focus on 3 rules changes that have been happened over the past 5 years  and when applied improve operational performance (emergency special working, high speed coasting, and contingency arrangements for GSM-R failures).

title: PHE _Scientific- Purchase of Cage, Bottle Washers & Allergen Containment Unit
description:
PHE invites expression of Interest from suppliers who wish to participate in the tender exercise for Provision of purchase of Cabinet washers (including cages & bottle) and allergen containment unit for the biological sciences division in Chilton.

Please send your EOI by responding to this message or by mailing into Scientific.procurement@phe.gov.uk.

The EOI will close on 30th April @15:00 hrs.

Thanking you,
Ruchika

title: Tenants' Contents Insurance 20 - North Tyneside Council - awarded
description:

title: Health and Wellbeing Interventions for Vulnerable Young People
description:
Working with young people in the NE29 postcode area, focusing on the most deprived areas of Chirton and Meadowell, to address key health and well-being needs.

Primarily, these will be in relation to mental health (including self harm), substance misuse (including drugs, alcohol and new psychoactive substances) and domestic violence, but also sexual health, physical health activity and healthy eating.

The Provider will work with and signpost and refer to key partners in order to meet the needs of young people. These may include CAMHS, Connexions, schools, Sport and Leisure, Youth Justice Service etc.
streetaddress: Quadrant, Cobalt Business Park The Silverlink North

title: PR 24 Team Dynamics
description:
Support from experienced consultancy to further develop the creation of the PR24 cluster,with the aim to help the PR24 team better work together in the future.

This consists of:

1:1s with key individuals
Ways of working/team dynamics session with the team
Additional days to support with follow up facilitation as required

title: Dynamic Purchasing System for Residential Substance Misuse Rehabilitation Services - 3rd Anniversary(12 month extension period)
SCAH Programme - Design Work
description:
Merrick will progress the design of building 950 and 951, taking account of the proposed future use of the Stewart Stockman Building and ongoing engagement with the Local Planning Authority. The design will define building massing, location and features such as indicative chimneystacks, energy centres etc. The production of a Strategic Basis of Design ("BOD") will be used to develop client knowledge, further inform stakeholders and provide a robust Client Brief for the engagement of Specialist Design Teams and Principle Contractors during 2020/21.

This process must include scheduled engagement with APHA and Defra users through the SCAH team and appointed Project Manager. The design of 950 and 951 should respond to the V17 of the User Requirement Brief ("URB"); the author, WSP, will provide ongoing support, interpretation and knowledge-transfer to Merrick where required.

Deliverables (due in time to be included and appended to the Client Brief)

1.	The development of a BOD up to RIBA 1; this will include, but not be limited to, the following:
a.	A RIBA 1 schematic design for the proposed in-vivo (950) and in-vitro (951) laboratory facilities, taking account of the proposed future use of Stewart Stockman Building (SSB). 
b.	Review, develop and validate the brief for building 950 (in-vivo), engaging industry-best practice and benchmarking reviews with laboratory planners and other specialists. This includes the ongoing and proposed future use of Coombelands and Grange Livestock Facilities and other supporting functions. This includes (a) internal floor layouts, (b) departmental/function adjacencies, (c) options on stacking arrangements, (d) opportunities for consolidated support functions, (e) review net:gross ratios, (f) assumptions on space allocation and (g) innovation and efficiency opportunities.
c.	Review, develop and validate the brief for building 951 (in-vitro), taking account of the potential future use(s) of SSB and engaging industry-best practice

GB-Coventry: Orbit Group Ltd - Mini Competition for Gas/Electricity/Gas & Electricity supplies 2020 (Lot 4)

title: Masterplan (including design of internal roads, drainage and services) in order to prepare investment ready plots at the North Magazine, Hereford Enterprise Zone.
description: The Hereford Enterprise Zone Board is responsible for the delivery of Skylon Park, Hereford Enterprise Zone. Skylon Park is a world-class business landscape, available for immediate development following over £20 million investment in infrastructure, and offers a high quality business environment in a parkland setting.  This service will be contracted with Herefordshire County Council, who are the principal backers of Hereford Enterprise Zone.  The North Magazine is the last substantial area of land remaining in Council ownership at 17 acres.  Considerable prior investment has been made over the past 10 years to clear and remediate the North Magazine site, raise the ground to reflect our flood strategy requirements, and install delineating landscape bunds. Road access has been brought to the site, and investment is being made to bring electricity, water, gas and broadband to the southern part of the site.

title: 001023 - Educational Seating
description: YPO are looking for Providers to be appointed onto a Framework Agreement for the provision of Educational Seating incorporating Chairs, Stools and Fabric Swivel Student Chairs to cover multiple environments and classroom setting predominantly (but not limited to) within the educational environments. The Framework can also be utilised by the Private Sector. This Framework is designed to allow YPO to meet the needs of all public sector organisations by establishing an agreement for Providers to deliver to YPO customers on a direct basis whereby the end customer places the order with YPO and YPO places the order with the Provider, but the Provider delivers direct to the end customer.

title: CONSTRUCTION OF NEW SHORT BREAKS & SUPPORTED LIVING UNITS OFF CROPSTON DRIVE, COALVILLE, LEICESTERSHIRE
description:
To carry out the construction of a Short Breaks unit and supported living units at Cropston Drive, Coalville.  
The site is owned by Leicestershire County Council, currently the site is under contract for the demolition of 46-50 Smith Crescent and 98 Cropston Drive. 44 Smith Crescent is fully operational, and the service will transfer to the Short Breaks unit once occupied completed as part of phase 1 of the works. This tender will require demolition of 44 Smith Crescent.

title: Town Investment Plan for Swindon
description:
Town Investment Plan for Swindon 
Swindon Borough Council invites expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced service providers for the provision of consultancy services.
Swindon Borough Council, on behalf of the Swindon Town Deal Board, is seeking to commission a provider for consultancy work to develop a Town Investment Plan for Swindon for completion of the final report by 10th July 2020, which will be owned and delivered by the Board.  This is an exciting opportunity to articulate a plan to drive economic growth and opportunity in the town by developing key projects to attract further investment.
The purpose of this specification is to outline the requirements and provide information enabling potential suppliers to tender for the work. The supplier will be required to work with the Town Deal Board to articulate Vision and Strategic Objectives and a Town Investment Plan which will comprise the framework for developing business cases for priority projects selected by the Board. The Town Investment Plan will form the basis of a bid to Government for schemes to the value of up to £25m.
The initial contract term will be for 4 months, commencing Wednesday 13th May 2020. Estimated contract spend is between £15,000 and £25,000 across the contract term.
Full details relating to the services are provided in the tender documents.
To participate, Suppliers will need to Register as a Supplier with ProContract, www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk, then Register an Interest before obtaining access to the tender documents. In the event of difficulties registering as a supplier, please refer to the System Administrator Proactis support team ProContractSuppliers@proactis.com

Please note that this project has been advertised on Contracts Finder/ other web portals, however, Supplying the South West Portal, https://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk/  is the only portal that includes all the relevant documents required to respond to this opportunity, bearing Project Id: DN475025
No Tender submissions will be considered without completing the tender documents in full including attachments and returning them in alignment with the instructions within the tender documents.

Swindon Borough Council invites expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced service providers for the provision of consultancy services.
Swindon Borough Council, on behalf of the Swindon Town Deal Board, is seeking to commission a provider for consultancy work to develop a Town Investment Plan for Swindon for completion of the final report by 10th July 2020, which will be owned and delivered by the Board.  This is an exciting opportunity to articulate a plan to drive economic growth and opportunity in the town by developing key projects to attract further investment.
The purpose of this specification is to outline the requirements and provide information enabling potential suppliers to tender for the work. The supplier will be required to work with the Town Deal Board to articulate Vision and Strategic Objectives and a Town Investment Plan which will comprise the framework for developing business cases for priority projects selected by the Board. The Town Investment Plan will form the basis of a bid to Government for schemes to the value of up to £25m.

title: Brighter Futures project final evaluation
description:
We are inviting applications from providers who are able to undertake a final evaluation of the Big lottery/ESF funded Brighter Futures project. Using methods in line with industry recommended best practice, by undertaking desk-based analyses of a wide variety of project evidence and conducting surveys and interviews with a representative sample of stakeholders, staff, participants, the provider will evaluate the project in terms of its performance, impact and value for money. The provider will be expected to present their findings in a written report that includes lessons learned and future recommendations. The provider will also disseminate their findings through social media and through a presentation given at one internal and one external stakeholder event. A full description of the requirements is included in the attached specification and questionnaire document which is also available at https://www.business2businesslimited.com/current-partnership-opportunities. If you are interested in supplying this provision, please complete the attached specification and questionnaire document and return to Rob Gray at rob@business2businesslimited.com by the submission deadline of 11.45pm on Friday 31st January 2020. 
      For all clarifications, please send written queries to rob@business2businesslimited.com. A response will be given within two working days of the query being raised. Within three working days of the query being made, the questions and answers document available at https://www.business2businesslimited.com/current-partnership-opportunities will be updated with an anonymised version of the query and the given response. The deadline for queries relating to this specification is 5pm on Thursday 23rd January 2020.
       
       Responses will be scored against fixed selection and award criteria. 
      
       The following selection criteria will be used:
      
      •	Organisational capacity
      •	Economic and financial standing
      •	Prior experience of service delivery
      
      Tenders that do not satisfy the above selection criteria will be de-selected from the procurement process.
      
      The following Most Economically Advantageous Tender (MEAT) award criteria will be used to score tenders that satisfy the selection criteria:
      
      •	Price 20%
      •	Merit of evaluation design 20%
      •	Quality of plans to engage project participants and stakeholders 20%
      •	Quality of the approach to be taken to calculating the social return on investment and local economic impact 20%
      •	Merit of planned approach to disseminating the evaluation findings 20%
      
      The highest scoring tender will be the winning tender. Only information supplied by tenderers in response to the questions will be taken into account during the scoring process.  
      
      Please note that additional information may be requested as part of our due diligence procedures. 
       
       Brighter Futures (https://www.business2businesslimited.com/brighterfutures) is a community-based project, which provides a wide range of learning and employment support interventions to support the holistic social inclusion of unemployed and economically inactive people aged 16+ within Leicester and Leicestershire. Delivered through a partnership of local organisations, the project is funded by the European Social Fund and the National Lottery, through the Big Lottery Fund. 
      The project began in December 2017 and was due to end in June 2020. However, a project extension granted by the Big Lottery and Leicester and Leicestershire LEP will enable the project to continue to meet the ongoing demand and need for support from local residents until Oct 2022.

      Please note that additional information may be requested as part of our due diligence procedures. 
       
       Brighter Futures (https://www.business2businesslimited.com/brighterfutures) is a community-based project, which provides a wide range of learning and employment support interventions to support the holistic social inclusion of unemployed and economically inactive people aged 16+ within Leicester and Leicestershire. Delivered through a partnership of local organisations, the project is funded by the European Social Fund and the National Lottery, through the Big Lottery Fund. 
      The project began in December 2017 and was due to end in June 2020. However, a project extension granted by the Big Lottery and Leicester and Leicestershire LEP will enable the project to continue to meet the ongoing demand and need for support from local residents until Oct 2022.

title: Cornwall Music Education Hub - Co-ordination & Delivery of school projects 2020/2021 - West Cornwall
description:
Cornwall Council, the lead partner of the Cornwall Music Education Hub (CMEH), seeks to contract a supplier to undertake to co-ordinate and deliver primary school projects in West Cornwall, as outlined in the delivery plan approved by The Arts Council.  Primarily the purpose of this work will be to support progression following First Access through targeted cluster projects, focusing on composition and playing of instruments. 

The deliverer can be a self-employed individual, or a named individual from an organisation and will be responsible for working in conjunction with the CMEH Manager to ensure that CMEH is engaging with all Cornish schools (includes special and AP Academies).

Functions
•	to support instrumental progression, especially after First Access
•	to deliver projects directly to students in cluster of schools, in conjunction with school staff
•	to encourage schools to provide the  opportunity to learn an instrument
•	to encourage schools to provide performance and ensemble opportunities
•	to increase staff confidence and skills in delivering music activity as part of project
•	to support schools with planning and delivering their music curriculum
•	to identify appropriate resources to support schools' needs 
•	to increase engagement with CMEH
•	to increase participation in music activity
Please see attached specification document

title: Medium-Scale (£15k - £225k) Building & Refurbishment Works for Blackpool Housing Company Owned Properties
description:
Blackpool Housing Company (BHC) are looking to appoint around 12 Contractors on a framework to provide medium-scale building works and refurbishment work to Blackpool Housing Company properties. The Company has an existing arrangement for small-scale, low-value works up to £15,000 but this contract will cover larger jobs estimated at costing between £15k - £225k.  
This current round (issued February 2020) is to appoint 5 Contractors to fill spaces on the existing framework.  Details in the following link: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=033376ff-ed80-e711-80e4-005056b64545

title: Legal Document Management System
description:
Legal Services provide legal advice to all Professional Service departments and Faculties across the University. This includes providing advice in minimising legal risk to the University across broad ranging areas of law such as commercial, employment, property, procurement and information law (e.g. freedom of information, subject access and data breaches); negotiating and reviewing commercial and education agreements, settling disputes (including through litigation) across our supply chain, or with students, employees or third parties and advising on the implementation or effect of legislative and regulatory requirements in the University.
The demands from a complex regulatory environment coupled with the University's strategic objectives is leading to an ever-increasing demand on the support provided by our department. At the moment, the team rely on an excel spread-sheet together with people-driven processes, email, SharePoint and J-drive to manage our case-load but this is inefficient and relies on too many manual processes with single points of failure increasing the risk exposure of the University.
The implementation of a legal case management system (an off the shelf solution) supported by robust processes and workflows is identified as a key element requiring implementation to assist in managing the risk faced by the University where important deadlines may be missed due to manual processes and single points of failure and this is particularly so in litigious matters.

title: PfH Fire Safety Works and Services Scotland
description: PfH Scotland is seeking to establish a framework agreement over 8 lots to cover fire safety design, installation, service and maintenance. The framework will be split across geographic regions and it is anticipated that 5 contractors will be appointed to each region and each lot. The Lots are - Lot 1 - Sprinkler and Fire Suppression Systems Installation, Service and Maintenance, Lot 2 - Sprinkler and Fire Suppression Systems Service and Maintenance, Lot 3 - Fire Alarm and Emergency Lighting Systems Installation, Service and Maintenance, Lot 4 - Fire Alarm and Emergency Lighting Systems Service and Maintenance, Lot 5 - Passive Works, Lot 6 - Whole Building Works, Lot 7 - Cladding, Lot 8 - Domestic Fire Alarms

title: Q071 - Bolton Music & Performing Arts Centre Architectural Design Services
description: The Borough Council of Bolton ("the Authority and/or Client") is prepared to receive tenders for Bolton Music & Performing Arts Centre Architectural Design Services which will be subject to the information, specification and tender package enclosed. his procurement exercise is being run as an open Invitation to Tender (ITT) and the Authority will appoint a single (1) contractor on the Contract. It is intended for the Contract to commence on 19 June 2020 and will end on 31 July 2020. To assist with its Future High Street Fund (FHSF) bid for Bolton town centre, the Borough Council of Bolton, (the "Client"), is seeking to appoint an architect (the "Consultant") to prepare RIBA Stage 2 plans for the Bolton Music & Performing Arts Centre. Please note, RIBA Stage 0 and Stage 1 have already been completed. This opportunity calls for innovative design proposals to create a new build, flagship cultural facility with the potential to have a transformational impact on Bolton Town Centre. It will be a place that responds to and captures Bolton's distinctive multi-cultural identity and enables the musical and broader educational and cultural life of the borough to grow. This enclosed document outlines: • The background to the brief • The site • The commission • Timetable and programme  The tender is available to apply via The Chest (www.the-chest.org.uk)

title: Highways England  Fleet Management Software
description:
This two-year contract opportunity is for the provision of a fleet management software to provide easy access to accurate vehicle data and history, including whole life vehicle cost analysis, vehicle maintenance records and day-to-day utilisation supporting good decision making for the following business areas:

-Traffic Officer Vehicles (TOV) - currently comprising of 240 Highways England-owned vehicles based across 39 operational out stations across the country. These vehicles operate 24/7/365 responding to incidents on the countries Strategic Road Network (SRN).

-Asset Delivery (AD) Vehicles - currently comprising of 175 Highways England-owned vehicles across multiple operational sites, managed by the Vehicles Team in Birmingham. These vehicles operate 12 hours/day inspecting the condition of the assets on the countries SRN. The number of vehicles within this fleet is expected to rise to 275 by 2021.

-Winter Fleet Vehicles - currently comprising of 437 vehicles across 100 operational sites. Vehicles are owned by Highways England but operated and maintained by third party service delivery contractors across 14 Areas. This fleet responds during periods of adverse weather to maintain flow across the SRN.

title: Thames Tideway Tunnel - C405 Main Works West - Hammersmith Inlet Channel Benching FRC Works
description:
The Thames Tideway Tunnel project (the Project) will control CSO discharges by intercepting and diverting combined sewage flows into a new storage and transfer tunnel. The main tunnel will run from Acton Storm Tanks in west London to Abbey Mills Pumping Station in the east, where it will connect to the Lee Tunnel, which will transfer the combined sewage to Beckton Sewage Treatment Works for treatment. The Project extends from Acton Storm Tanks in west London, to Abbey Mills Pumping Station in east London. The Project includes associated works at Beckton STW, Shad Thames Pumping Station and Bekesbourne Street. 
    
    The geographic layout of the Project and local authorities through which it passes is shown in Figure 1.
    The Project comprises:
    a. tunnels:
    i. a main tunnel which will capture and store combined sewage from CSOs along its route and transfer it to Abbey Mills Pumping Station, from where the Lee Tunnel will transfer it for treatment at Beckton Sewage Treatment Works
    ii. 11 connection tunnels, which will link flows from CSOs to the main tunnel.
    b. Worksites:
    i. five main tunnel Worksites (drive and/or reception sites)
    ii. 16 CSO Worksites
    iii. two System modification Worksites Thames Tideway Tunnel
    iv. works at Beckton Sewage Treatment works.
    
    Scope of Works
    
    The Hammersmith Pumping Station (HAMPS) Inlet Channel forms part of a live sewage pumping station infrastructure. It will remain operational throughout the duration of the project. This is a gravity-fed storm relief pumping station, with no physical or mechanical means of isolating the two sewers entering the Inlet Channel wet weather, thus all works are weather-dependent. 
    
    In order to ensure safety of the working teams, BMB have implemented a series of real-time catchment sewer monitoring along with computer modelling and weather forecast modelling tools which form part of the safe system of works (more details can be provided on request). Within the Inlet Channel, two temporary weir walls were installed, which are interconnected with a series of flumes to divert the flows through the works area (referred to as dry zone), effectively creating a cofferdam within the sewer environment 
    
    BMB JV are required to construct 4no elements of additional benching structures within the HAMPS Inlet Channel (highlighted in Figure 2), as follows:
    
    1.	Benching constructed on top of the base slab - 8m log, 2m wide (at base) with the outer face sloping towards the north wall at 45o, 750mm high. The subcontractor is to design, supply and install the formwork for this element. B16 dowels and face tension reinforcement bars (at 150mm c/c) will be supplied by BMB but will need cutting / bending and fixing by the subcontractor - no reinforcement drg is available at this stage but it is envisaged to have less than 100mm B16 bars. 
     
    2.	Mass section of mass benching on top of the existing wall benching - upstream of the temporary weir wall. The section will have curved faces - BMB will provide the formwork design and polystyrene Cordeck infill panels made to required shape - (combination of RDM / Cordeck formwork) - the Subcontractor to provide the remainder materials for the formwork and assemble it.
    
    3.	Mass section of mass benching on top of the existing wall benching - upstream of the temporary weir wall. The section will have curved faces - BMB will provide the formwork design and polystyrene Cordeck infill panels made to required shape - (combination of RDM / Cordeck formwork) - the Subcontractor to provide the remainder materials for the formwork and assemble it.
    
    
    4.	Bullnose' mass benching installed on top of the existing slab, against the wall section between the two sewer portals. This section will be curved in multiple directions - BMB will provide the formwork design and polystyrene Cordeck infill panels made to required shape - (combination of RDM / Cordeck formwork) - the Subcontractor to provide the remainder materials for the formwork and assemble it.
    Please note that entry upstream of the upstream temporary weir wall (items 2 and 3) is only possible during the safe tide window (+/- 2hrs from the low tide at Hammersmith) - a spreadsheet with exact tides for May and July was attached for reference. As north wall benching (item 1) is not restricted to low tide working, the Subcontractor's programme should allow for overlapping the activities such the low tide window is used for the upstream works and the remainder of the shift can be used for constructing Item 1 benching as well as all enabling works. 
    
     
     Returned quotations will be evaluated by BMB JV's (BAM Nuttall, Morgan Sindall PLC & Balfour Beatty) Procurement team in conjunction with our design and engineering teams.
    Quotations will be evaluated based on;
    Cost
    Timeliness of return
    Adherence to and demonstration of understanding of the drawings and specifications provided at this point.
    Provision of accurate product specifications to accompany the quotation.
    Supplier experience of similar projects,evidence of this will be requested should the initial quotation be of interest.
    Should the candidate supplier be shortlisted they will then be contacted directly by a member of the BMB Procurement Team within two weeks of shortlisting to discuss the requirement in detail. 
     BMB Joint Venture (BAM Nuttall, Morgan Sindall PLC & Balfour Beatty) 
     Hammersmith Site
buyer: BMB Joint Venture (BAM Nuttall, Morgan Sindall PLC & Balfour Beatty)

title: Refurbishment of play area - Ogle Drive, Blyth
description: Blyth Town Council are looking to engage the services of a suitably qualified provider to carry out the refurbishment work of a play area within the Ogle Drive area of the Town.  Further details are provided in the available documentation or by contacting the Council.  The start date will be 1 June 2020 and the work must be completed by 17 July 2020. The Council are in the process of seeking the necessary planning permission.

title: Case Management Securing our Technical Future
description:
Infrastructure and technology upgrade to transfer Case Management technology to a Cloud platform.
This will include re-hosting a number of key applications onto Cloud (AWS in this instance), as well as re-platforming onto latest versions of supported underlying software (Pega & Documentum).  This work requires specific skills and, in particular, Cloud Hosting & niche technology capabilities.

title: 1-1026 Technical spport for Vehicle Restraint System (VRS) Data and Decision Support Tool (DST) Scoping Requirements
description:
Highways England is seeking to commission expert external advice to provide independent subject matter expert (SME) support to:
-	Build on the Road Period 2 (RP2) strategic investment case developed for VRS, examining the sources of data and the capability used to derive the RP2 analysis to inform the needs for a future in-house DST.

-	Characterisation of VRS asset data inventory, condition data requirements / processes and the quality of the asset information to underpin the RP2 programme and decision-making as part of RP3 planning.

-	Gather and define company requirements for a VRS DST including:
o	Technical approaches to VRS renewals and scheme development needs (tactical / operational)
o	RP2 investment case for VRS and RP3 case needs (strategic)
o	Asset management, metrics and reporting needs
o	Assets which need to be included as part of the VRS DST which are already recorded, or form part of the road restraint system, structures or other related asset classes are to be included in the VRS DST, for instance end terminals
o	Engage with asset management system owners and Consultants to evaluate existing or future capabilities for effective digital information exchange e.g. through an Application Programming Interface (API) or similar communication protocol and make recommendations for digital exchange with a DST

-	Produce a list of functional and non-functional requirements against which evaluation of the market can be applied

-	Evaluate current standards and existing data used by the business

-	Develop implementation plan for data improvements

-	Assess the capabilities of commercially available products against Highways England's requirements

-	Identify and assess preferred options for procurement and configuration of a VRS DST including consideration of potential implementation into existing company DSTs 

-	Assess capability requirements to analyse and model VRS data to inform future road periods; bringing capability into Highways England

title: Running Event Organisation and Operating Services
description:
The Slough Borough Council (The Authority) Half Marathon was organised and delivered by the council in October 2018.  Due to the pressures of organising and delivering the event, it was decided that the most appropriate and efficient way to deliver this event in the future would be to outsource the event to a professional organiser (the Service Provider).
      
      The contract will be for 3 years with an option to extend for two further periods of 1 year each.
      
      The event will take place on a Sunday morning between the 20th September to 11th October 2020 and equivalent periods in any subsequent year.
      
      The Event must cater for at least 1000 participants.
      
      The Service Provider must ensure that they are United Kingdom Athletics (UKA) Licensed and will comply with UKA Guidelines throughout the event as defined at https://www.runbritain.com/shared/get-file.ashx?itemtype=document&id=1930
      
      The Service Provider is solely responsible for its costs in operating the event and the Council will not provide any funding or subsidy to the Service Provider beyond the provision of its staff for the performance of the Council's duties in relation to the planning or running of the event.

title: ADM - Lifecycle and CCS Legal Advice
description:
Using experience and knowledge from their advisory role during the procurement of our alternative delivery model support contract in 2017/18,provide additional legal advice to support OFWAT with matters relating to the same contract

The Contractor to provide legal advice on:
Novation to CCS
Variation to ADM contract 
Outstanding work packages, and subsequent Bluejeans assessment
Advice to include communications and dialogue between the Contractor and PWC lawyers as required

title: Inward Investment Services
description:
The draft Kent and Medway Enterprise and Productivity Strategy places a strong emphasis on the importance of attracting inward investment, and for locally based agencies to work closely with government agencies to bring new investment into the area. The draft Strategy places a strong emphasis on increasing our promotion of Kent and Medway as a UK inward investment gateway, with a commitment required from Government and the Department for International Trade (DIT) to match local support for inward investment where it is focused around sectors in which Kent and Medway have particular strengths. 

Kent County Council is seeking a supplier that can be the inward investment agency for Kent and Medway. The successful supplier must have an excellent understanding of the key issues companies face when looking to relocate, an understanding of the industrial and commercial property market in Kent and Medway, how to identify and develop leads, how to support companies during the relocation process, and how to support relocated companies following relocation. The successful supplier should have a strong track record of delivering similar services. The core of the contract will be to provide support to SMEs, in accordance with the requirements of ESIF Programme, but the successful candidate will also be required to support non-SMEs. This part of the contract will not be funded by ERDF. The successful supplier will be expected to deliver, alongside Kent County Council and Medway Council, specific outcomes that contribute to economic development in Kent and Medway and will work closely with stakeholders in the county and internationally, including DIT and the South East Local Enterprise Partnership. Prospective bidders are required to specify how they will perform this role, and to show a proven track record in such delivery. The successful supplier will develop innovative and creative solutions to secure inward investment in Kent and Medway. 

The key features of the service are; Securing external investment into Kent and Medway that creates new jobs; Promoting Kent and Medway to overseas markets; Maintaining close contact with investing businesses through an after-care programme. Prospective bidders are required to specify how they will deliver these. The successful supplier will also demonstrate how it will deliver and contribute to the following economic outcomes for Kent and Medway: More investment opportunities from overseas markets; Increased supply chain benefits for local businesses; More inward investment in Kent and Medway; Raised profile as a destination for inward and foreign direct investment. 

The Selection Questionnaire consists of a range of pass/fail questions, only Candidates who meet the minimum criteria will proceed to receive the Tender process. 
This notice is placed in consideration of The Public Contract Regulations, Regulation 32 (9) to (12), subject to additional funding being made available during the lifetime of the contract

title: Tonge Start Well Centre Early Education and Childcare Opportunity
description:
In Bolton our aim is to ensure the best outcomes for children by making sure the free early years places are delivered safely and to a consistently high standard. We will work collaboratively with providers and parents to offer families high quality provision.

Applications are invited to set up high quality childcare provision in the following building:

Tonge Start Well Centre
Starkie Road,
Bolton
BL2 2ED

Bolton Start Well Service (the "Service") is offering an opportunity for a suitable early education and childcare provider (the "Provider") to run on-site sustainable, high-quality provision in the dedicated nursery section of the Tonge Start Well Centre.

Tonge Start Well Centre is an excellent location for a nursery setting, serving housing estates in the Tonge area. It is in one of the more disadvantaged areas of Bolton and will attract funding for eligible two year old children. Tonge Start Well Centre offers a range of activities and integrated support services to support families with parenting so children get the best start in life. A wide range of services are offered from the centre including Antenatal and Well Baby Clinics; Stay and Play sessions, community activity and Tonge Church. It is also close to local shops, post office, doctors, dentist and a number of primary schools. The building benefits from good transport links and is only ten minutes out of Bolton Town Centre ensuring good access for families.

The Provider will be offered a dedicated nursery unit, with toilets, office, storage space and shared use of the kitchen (with specified storage space). The property has recently been decorated including new flooring. There are purpose built toilets and sinks for the children.
The building benefits from a large car park and secure outdoor play space which has a grass and tarmac areas. This is fenced / gated and will be for exclusive use by the nursery. 

The Service is therefore inviting expressions of interest from good and outstanding providers who wish to deliver a quality service within the building.

There is an open session to view the building on Wednesday 11 March 2020, 18:00hrs.

The Provider will be offered a dedicated nursery unit, with toilets, office, storage space and shared use of the kitchen (with specified storage space). The property has recently been decorated including new flooring. There are purpose built toilets and sinks for the children.
The building benefits from a large car park and secure outdoor play space which has a grass and tarmac areas. This is fenced / gated and will be for exclusive use by the nursery. 

The Service is therefore inviting expressions of interest from good and outstanding providers who wish to deliver a quality service within the building.

There is an open session to view the building on Wednesday 11 March 2020, 18:00hrs.", "supplyChain": false, "hasEnquiries": null, "tenderPeriod": {"endDate": "2020-03-23T00:00:00Z"}, "awardCriteria": null, "submissionMethod": null, "xClassifications": {"isSuitableForSme": true, "isSuitableForVco": true, "ojeuContractType": "Services"}, "procurementMethod": null, "eligibilityCriteria": null, "awardCriteriaDetails": null, "submissionMethodDetails": "Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section.", "procurementMethodDetails": "Not applicable", "procurementMethodRationale": ""}, "language": "en-GB", "initiationType": "tender"}], "publisher": {"uid": "https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733", "uri": "https://openopps.com", "name": "Open Opps", "scheme": "Companies House"}, "publishedDate": "2020-05-08T02:11:15.198494+00:00"}

title: NHSBT1212 Planned Preventative Maintenance and Reactive Maintenance and Minor Works
description:
Expressions of interest are required from suitably qualified and experienced contractors who wish to tender for the provision of a comprehensive mechanical, electrical, building and grounds maintenance service comprising:
A planned preventative maintenance service.
A reactive maintenance service to be available 24 hours a day 365 days a year.
Minor works projects involving refurbishment, alteration and/or upgrade works.
The service will be on a National basis to cover all NHSBT occupied premises located throughout England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland

title: Catering Services for Cafe at Anglia Ruskin University's Guild House campus, Peterborough
description: Anglia Ruskin University is seeking a catering partner to provide catering services for the Cafe at their Guild House campus in Peterborough, which is a dedicated health, education and social care campus.As part of ARU's future vision and strategy, it is expanding their partnering relationships.Catering at Guild House is currently proved by PRC Ventures based at Peterborough College.  The facilities provide a small cafe on the top floor that is supported by an open kitchen.  Current turnover is approx GPB 21k per annum, and is a 12 month a year operation.  ARU pay a capped subsidy of GBP 1.5k per month to the incumbent to cover the cost of service.The opportunity is for a fixed term two year contract from 1st July 2020 to 1st July 2022 and may be the start of a more progressive partnership with ARU.Current opening hours are 08:30 to 16:00, but the University would consider 09:30 to 15:30 for a justifiable business case.   We are advised TUPE will not apply, but interested parties will be informed of this as the opportunity prevails.A tender for this requirement will be released by 28 Feb 2020. The successful organisation will be required to commence services on 01.07.20. A tender meeting and site visit is being held on 05.03.20 at Guild House (PE2 9PW). Please see Additional Information for more details and register your interest via Panache Consultancy at email -  gailheath@panacheconsultancy.co.uk by midday 03.03.20 if of interest.ARU are looking specifically for:1)	A bread based offer with a small selection of hot food items such as pastries, pies, soup, baked potatoes, etc.2)	An attractive facility that is welcoming, offers choice with attentive customer service.3)	Healthy choices that are attractive to the student base at Peterborough campus.4)	A branded coffee offer.5)	A value for money tariff.6)	Hospitality and internal delivered services when requested.7)	Reliability of service provision and cover in team absences.8)	Client value for money through the subsidy.9)	Contractor incentivised management fee to help generate success.There is no need for capital investment, although Tenderers may be interested in supporting the services through additional equipment/concept supply.

title: Deal Structure Advisor
description:
The London Borough of Barnet ("the Council") seeks to appoint a Provider to deliver Deal Structure Advisory Service. This service is about provide a review and report on proposed deal structure for the London Borough of Barnet/ Middlesex University Joint Venture, through the utilisation of public and private funding vehicles.
This advert is a formal invitation to participate.

title: Shaping Success: Effective Maths and English CPD for practitioners working in post-16 Education and Training
description: The Education and Training Foundation (ETF) aims to drive up standards in maths and English for all learners. An independent evaluation of our maths and English programmes found that our flexible, integrated and bespoke support has more traction if it is embedded in sustained professional development like, for example, joint practice development projects, professional networks and practitioner-led research. In order to continuously improve the standards in maths and English, this tender will build on and further develop the following programmes:Shaping SuccessMaths and English Regional Specialist LeadsFunctional Skills Action Research Projects

title: DurhamWorks Phase 2 Evaluation 2018-2021
description:
Durham County Council would like to engage the services of a single provider to undertake an Evaluation of the DurhamWorks Programme 2018-2021

DurhamWorks has been created as the vehicle to deliver the learning, training, employment, support, and development activities which are funded under European Social Fund (ESF) and Youth Employment Initiative (YEI) funding.  

This contract is specifically to engage a single provider of evaluation services.  Further information of the contract requirements are detailed in ITT Document 2 - Part 1 Service Specification which can be found on www.nepo.org.

title: Provision of Home to School Transport in the Kendal area (T5712)
description:
Tenders are invited for the provision of passenger transport services by taxi, minibus and/or coach in relation to Home to School in the Kendal area

The minimum number of seats required is 4 (No passenger assistant required)

You must refer to the "Instructions for Tendering" prior to submitting your bid. 

All submissions must be uploaded and returned via the Chest 

The documents that must be included in your submission are:
		
		Information and Declaration
		Tender Pricing Submission 
		Daily timetable template 

The deadline for submission is:

10:00 Wednesday 19 February 2020


PLEASE ENSURE YOU HAVE UPLOADED ALL THE REQUIRED DOCUMENTS AS FAILURE TO DO SO MAY RESULT IN YOUR TENDER SUBMISSION NOT BEING CONSIDERED

title: Consultancy services for a Feasibility Study and Surveys at York Rise Orpington
description:
The Council would now like to commission detailed surveys that will determine the full viability and any associated costs of preparing the site for housing.  For clarity we are not looking for a consultant to consider the housing development, but instead to assess the requirements and associated costs of preparing the site and produce a Report on the sites' suitability. 	                                       
The Council is seeking a suitable consultant to undertake the following surveys, and analyse the outcome of these surveys for the proposed intended purpose of housing development: Refer to the Client Brief document.r housing development.

title: Independent Evaluator: Croydon Community Partnership Against Trauma
description:
The successful vendor will join the Croydon Community Partnership Against Trauma (CCPAT).  CCPAT is one of many projects that is key to Croydon's long-term strategy to reduce youth violence by building partnerships that bring families, schools and local communities together in an integrated programme that equips young people with the tools to overcome a range of adverse childhood experiences and the skills to achieve their goals.                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                The specific role of the vendor will be to independently evaluate the efficacy of a three year project.  

The successful vendor will participate in an exercise to finalise KPIs - including commenting on baselines and ongoing targets.  

They will also provide annual analysis of standardised performance information, including comparison to one or more control group.

The successful vendor will also provide an end of project report.
APPLY HERE: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=024da3df-815c-ea11-80ff-005056b64545&fromProjectDashboard=True
