title: Fleming Way Multi Storey Car Park - External Works 2020
description: Swindon Borough Council invites expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced service providers for the provision of maintenance works and materials to address render / coating defects on the external elevations of Fleming Way Multi-Storey Car-Park (MSCP), and to improve the structure's aesthetic appearance. Project Description: Full details relating to the Works are provided in the tender documents. To participate, Suppliers will need to Register as a Supplier with ProContract, www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk, then Register an Interest before obtaining access to the tender documents. In the event of difficulties registering as a supplier, please refer to the System Administrator Proactis support team at ProContractSuppliers@proactis.com Contract Period: The contract will be initially for a period of 2 months commencing May 2020. Tender Responses: Tender responses are required to be submitted via email (including the project name clearly in the e-mail title) to hppd@swindon.gov.uk by no later than 27th March 2020 at 12:00 hrs UK local time. Tender Clarifications: If you require any clarifications on the tender documents, please submit these in writing via e-mail (including the project name clearly in the e-mail title) to hppd@swindon.gov.uk by 18th March 2020 at 12.00 UK local time. The Council's responses to these clarification questions will be issued periodically on the ProContract tender portal. Please note that Supplying the South West Portal is the only portal that includes all the relevant documents required to respond to this opportunity (Project Id: DN169221). No Tender submissions will be considered without completing the tender documents in full including attachments and returning them in alignment with the instructions within the tender documents.

title: PHE - Corporate - Digital - Accessibility Audit 2 (G-Cloud)
description: Public Health England, an executive agency of the Department of Health and Social and Social Care (DH) (hereafter referred to as "Public Health England" or "PHE" also referred to as the "Contracting Authority" or the "Authority" or the "Employer") have awarded Digital Accessibility Centre (DAC) Ltd a 2 year Call-Off Contract with the option to extend a further two years year via G-Cloud 11 Framework Agreement (RM1557.11). PHE require DAC to assess and make recommendations on digital media that is accessible to all members of the population and meets best practice accessibility standards and legislations.

title: Fraud Error and Debt - Optical Character Recognition Solution
description: The current Altia application has 2 separate tools. The first is an Optical Character Recognition (OCR) tool, the second is an Analysis tool.  These tools are used by SOC FIU and analysts to support them in the analysis of large volumes of financial data/bank statements in order to assist and progress their investigations.  Some of the functionality this software assists with include, Identifying criminality, identifying patterns and trends in the activity of organised criminal gangs, double counting activity.  Without this software the only other option would be to manually input the data into Microsoft Excel, this process could take several days/weeks to input.  This contract will be for the development of a replacement bespoke Optical Character Recognition (OCR) Solution.

title: RICS VALUER Panel
description:
WCHG have a requirement for a RICS Valuer panel. The panel will be comprised of 2 to 4 Valuers per Lot. The contract will be split into two lots, which can be applied to in isolation or in unison. This accommodates for the valuation and reporting for new build schemes. As well as our Buyback programme and Right to Buy / Acquire properties. 
      Lot 1 - Land, Sales and Rental Values 
      Lot 2 - Buyback properties; Right to Buy/Acquire Properties; Annual Rent Review.

title: Provision of Consultancy for Financial Impact Assessment Support
description: Defence Academy Requirement for Financial Impact Assessment Support. The MoD require consultancy in order to review all aspects of existing contracts let under Private Finance Initiatives. This will include the current and future financial position of the current service providers, contract documentation review and their financial profile, identify gaps in performance and a range of available options.

description:

title: PROVISION OF REHABILITATION, REABLEMENT AND TRANSITIONAL CARE IN A CARE HOME
description:
Hartlepool Borough Council, in collaboration with the Stockton & Hartlepool CCG, seeks to commission a rehabilitation, renablement and transitional care service through the block purchase of 20 beds in a designated unit within a registered care home in Hartlepool.  

The service will be available to all adults over the age of 18 and be inclusive of older people with a dementia. It will target people who would otherwise face unnecessarily prolonged hospital stays, inappropriate hospital admission or long term residential care. 

The service will commence on 1st June 2020 for a period of 3 years

title: Quotation for ICT Print Unit   MIS Replacement System
description:
OVERVIEW
      The Central Print Unit provides a printing resource and processes requests from various sections of Sandwell MBC, external companies and local members.  The orders vary from 1 print request to thousands.
      The system currently used is 20 + years old and has not been supported for several years.  It runs on Vista and is not compatible with the current Windows Operating system & Office 365.  No back-ups are taken.
      There is a requirement to replace this existing system so that it is compliant with the current ICT infrastructure and security.
      The replacement system is to be supplied on an initial 2-year contract with the option to extend for up to a further 2 years, with full support and maintenance. Applicants are required to submit prices for the initial contract period and the optional extension period.

title: Anchor Hanover - Media Buying Advertising
description:
1.	Overview
The provision of integrated offline and online media buying services for the Anchor Hanover Group.

2.	Deliverables
The media agency shall support Anchor Hanover to effectively buy, measure and report offline and online media for its Group product portfolio. Products and services to include care homes, rental housing, leasehold housing, retirement villages, plus other business services such as recruitment, where required.

To access the opportunity please go to URL & register here - https://anchorhanover.wax-live.com/S2C/Bespoke/AnchorHanover/AnchorHanoverRegistration.aspx

title: SBC 1119 The Provision of Pest Control Service  - AWARD
description:
Stevenage Borough Council are currently seeking tenders  for the provision of pest control services
      The tender documents can be accessed from the 'My Tenders' area of the Supply Hertfordshire website and selecting the 'View Details' button of this project.
      
      Please note the deadline for returns and allow sufficient time to make your return as late returns will not be permitted.
      Any questions relating to this tender should be made via correspondence on the website and can be addressed to the main contact as shown in the details above.

title: Lewisham's School Minor Works Programme 2020 - Contract 3
description:
Lewisham Council wishes to procure a contractor to undertake roofing works to the primary schools described below. These works will form part of the wider Schools Minor Works Programme 2020.

The works shall comprise but not be limited to the following:

1) Perrymount Primary School
New overlay system to the existing corrugated metal roofing together with the replacement of existing fragile rooflights

2) Eliot Bank Primary School
Replacement of existing defective roof coverings including insulated valley gutters, soffits and rainwater goods

title: On-boarding process for Care Homes
description:
NHS Kernow and the Council are pleased to invite care home providers to join the new joint contract for Care Home services from April 2020.
As statutory commissioning authorities we are required under the Public Contract Regulations (2015) to ensure we use a compliant process for purchasing services. In order to balance this with our duties under the Patient Choice Regulations (2013) and the Care Act (2014), we have developed a bespoke process for care home services in Cornwall. This is intended to ensure a clear and straightforward process that will not preclude registered providers from joining the new contractual arrangements.

title: EWI Works
description:
Removal of existing non compliant external wall insulation and replacement  with a compliant system to all external elavations. The work is to be carried out to  a four storey purpose built homeless hostel located in the centre of Bristol City with residents in occupance throughout the full duration of the works.  It is likely the hostel will be at full capacity throughout all of the works.

The process is being overseen by SAHA Consulant Pellings,  for further details please contact

Gary Reynolds, Partner FCIOB, FRICS
Tel ; 0208 460 9114
Email ; GReynolds@pellings.co.uk

title: Transport Modeller Recruitment
description:
The Department for Transport (DfT) invites proposals for a Recruitment Agency/Consultancy with proven expertise of recruiting Senior Transport Modellers to join DfTs Appraisal and Strategic Analysis team based in London. The department has two Senior Transport Modeller vacancies that need filling. 

The full tender document pack, including the role profile, will be accessible through DfTs AWARD e-Sourcing portal. DfT will issue the AWARD e-Sourcing portal registration to Tenderers requested through Contracts Finder. To permit this, tenderers will be required to register onto the e-Sourcing portal for this specific requirement. To register, please send an email detailing company name, the full name of the requestor and an email address to Costaki.costi@dft.gov.uk 

The tender submission deadline is 25 March 2020.

title: Homes England - Peterborough Town Sites Landscape Maintenance and Cleansing Contract 2020 - 2023
description: Homes England is currently seeking to appoint a competent Supplier for the provision of landscape maintenance and cleansing services within the Peterborough area. There are currently 11 sites within Homes England's Peterborough portfolio. The Sites vary in size and character, and include public open space, land reserved for future development and residual land left over from residential and commercial development. The contract is envisaged to have duration of 2 years with provision for a further 1 year extension under the same Terms and Conditions of this contract. Any contract extensions will be based on tendered Rates and Prices. Typical planned Services under this contract comprise of but are not exclusively limited to the following: Site inspections, whereby the Supplier shall indicate; all matters relating to the maintenance specification, recommendations for necessary Service, incidences of vandalism, fly tipping, trespass and adjustments to the scheduled Service; Grass Cutting; Hedge Cutting; Weed Control; and Cleansing. This contract is a performance based, the performance of which will be monitored via Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).
buyer: Homes England (the name adopted by the Homes and Communities Agency)

title: DInfoCom/0105 - Provision of Smart & Interactive Touch Displays, Laptops and Standard Items List
description:
There are a number of organisations within the Army TLB that have a need for smart or interactive touch screens in the business, operational and training environments.  Given the overall numbers likely to be procured there would appear to be benefit in standardising the procurement in order to achieve sensible commonality and economies of scale.  It is accepted that some very specialist requirements will fall outside any standard items list.   

There is also a requirement for the provision of laptop computers to support individual skills progression for those personnel identified to complete L2 Cyber Upskilling process delivered under the CEMA Level 2 Upskilling Project (circa 2000 personnel).

title: Improving Land Use Change Tracking in the UK Greenhouse Gases Inventory
description:
BEIS is seeking a contractor to improve the tracking of Land Use Change in the UK Greenhouse Gas inventory. 
      BEIS is looking to hold a Supplier Event on the 19th of March 2020 in support of a proposed Invitation to Tender.  Places will be allocated on a first come, first served basis to one representative per organisation, as space will be restricted.

title: Non-Household Customer Insight Survey
description:
DPS Agreement (RM6018)
The priorities, views and experiences of customers are essential in understanding whether, and how, the market is functioning effectively and delivering for customers. We also wish to assess the efficacy of any policy interventions, for example concerning whether customer experiences of billing has improved.
To inform our understanding here, we need to gauge the experiences and views of customers, including the extent to which customers have chosen to engage with the market, their needs and expectations have been met, and the reasons for these outcomes.
One of the ways we intend to do this is through regular surveying of a sample of all eligible customers (not just those who have switched retailer or renegotiated a deal with their existing retailer.)
We want to commission new customer research to provide:
•	performance metrics, e.g. what percentage of customers are aware of the market - in particular to provide consistent and comparable trend analysis with the results of our 2017/18 research;
•	an understanding of what customers think the market may offer them, what they may want  and what may motivate them to engage, and what they may currently be getting from the market; and
•	customers' experiences of the market, e.g. impediments to engaging with or getting the best out of the market, has switching been a good experience, or have their issues and complaints been dealt with effectively?
The results of the research must be statistically robust and comprehensive enough for us to identify where the market is failing to deliver for customers, and the reasons why. The outputs of the research will feed into two key areas:
-	Firstly, they will help us judge whether and how to intervene in the market in order to ensure customers are protected and the market works efficiently and effectively.
-	Secondly, the survey results will form a key part of our second annual 'state of the market' report, presently scheduled for publication in July 2019. As such the outputs of the work must be clear, comprehensive and robust, and allow consistent and comparable trend analysis with the results of our 2017/18 research.

The priorities, views and experiences of customers are essential in understanding whether, and how, the market is functioning effectively and delivering for customers. We also wish to assess the efficacy of any policy interventions, for example concerning whether customer experiences of billing has improved.
To inform our understanding here, we need to gauge the experiences and views of customers, including the extent to which customers have chosen to engage with the market, their needs and expectations have been met, and the reasons for these outcomes.
One of the ways we intend to do this is through regular surveying of a sample of all eligible customers (not just those who have switched retailer or renegotiated a deal with their existing retailer.)
We want to commission new customer research to provide:
•	performance metrics, e.g. what percentage of customers are aware of the market - in particular to provide consistent and comparable trend analysis with the results of our 2017/18 research;
•	an understanding of what customers think the market may offer them, what they may want  and what may motivate them to engage, and what they may currently be getting from the market; and
•	customers' experiences of the market, e.g. impediments to engaging with or getting the best out of the market, has switching been a good experience, or have their issues and complaints been dealt with effectively?
The results of the research must be statistically robust and comprehensive enough for us to identify where the market is failing to deliver for customers, and the reasons why. The outputs of the research will feed into two key areas:
-	Firstly, they will help us judge whether and how to intervene in the market in order to ensure customers are protected and the market works efficiently and effectively.
-	Secondly, the survey results will form a key part of our second annual 'state of the market' report, presently scheduled for publication in July 2019. As such the outputs of the work must be clear, comprehensive and robust, and allow consistent and comparable trend analysis with the results of our 2017/18 research.

title: UK SBS CR20024 - Entrepreneurial-University Eco-system: Scoping: Sector Characteristics - Pharmaceuticals
description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids is Tuesday, 17th March 2020.

DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.

All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.

Brief Description of Requirement

This study is focussed on the Pharmaceuticals sector, and there are two other sector studies - on fintech and fashion - being commissioned separately. The three sector studies are intended to be based upon deep experience and insight of the specific sector being examined.   The three sector studies, and a separate quantitative study on sizing the overall opportunity in the deep dive being commissioned separately, will all inform next steps.  Work in this stage takes account of the SQW technical note, which suggested the likely scale and wide range needed in a deep dive, and hence the need to consider carefully scope and methodology. 

Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Document Uploads tab within the Delta eSourcing Portal.

This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria set out in the ITQ  document. 

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement. 

To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link https://uksbs.delta-esourcing.com and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://uksbs.delta-esourcing.com and the follow the instructions to 'Login' 

Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: 4DZS4S5978

Please disregard any content in this notice that requests your organisation "to apply directly to the buyer" as this unfortunately a system generated error, that is outside of the Contracting Authorities control.

title: Living Well @ Home (regulated home based care/domiciliary care)
description: The Trust intends to let a pseudo Framework Agreement under Regulations 74 to 77 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (Light Touch Regime).  The Trust are seeking to contract with a number of home care Providers through a pseudo open framework agreement from 1st April 2020 for 5 years with the option to extend for a further 3 years.  We currently purchase circa 7,000 hours per week and we need to develop our market to fill outstanding packages of care. We anticipate opening the procurement annually/as and when required for new applicants and/or lots, extending the scope beyond standard home based care/domiciliary care.  The Trust is issuing an Invitation to Participate ahead of the final specifications and confirmation of rates.  This will allow potential Providers to familiarising themselves with the relevant Selection Questionnaire and Award Criteria Questions. At a later date the Trust will issue the final specification and rates, and then set the date and time for the closure of this Contract Notice. We will provide potential Providers a reasonable amount of time to formalise their response.  Complimentary Information: The Trust intends to let a pseudo Framework Agreement under Regulations 74 to 77 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (Light Touch Regime).

title: A NEW 'VISION FOR WINCHESTER' 2020-2030 - AWARD
description:
The Town Forum now wishes to produce a new Vision for Winchester to articulate aspirations for the town over the next ten years or so, not only for those who live in the area but also in its contribution to the wider district. This will function as an overarching framework for more detailed work on specific issues and as a clear statement of what the preferred long term outcomes of decision making will be.
      
      The Contract will commence on 2nd February 2020 and and ends on 30th June 2020
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 12.00 hrs on Friday 10th January 2020.

title: Supply of Traffic Cameras and Image Hosting Service
description:
This Framework is for supply of Cameras Associated Equipment and an Image Hosting & Support Service for Traffic Monitoring within the County of Durham.

Durham County Council is seeking to appoint a single supplier.  If you are successful you will be appointed to the Framework.  Following appointment the Council may make call-offs against the Framework Agreement on the basis of you being the sole supplier on the Framework and you will be expected to respond to meet the demand of the Council's planned programme.  However, should you be unable to meet the requirements of any order then the Council reserves the right to approach other contractors to carry out such order.

Babraham Institute Facility, CB22 3AT

This Single Sourcing Action (SSA) was approved in line with Regulation 32.

title: 2020-02-27 1300 Sudbury to Cathedral View, Bury St Edmunds or Finborough Road, Stowmarket (Respite Transport) - AWARD
description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `The supply of Passenger Transport Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2018/S 031-067685.
      
      Sudbury to Cathedral View, Bury St Edmunds or Finborough Road, Stowmarket (Respite Transport) - 4 seats, no passenger assistant, required.
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is 1pm on Thursday 27th February 2020. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is 5pm on Wednesday 26th February 2020 which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website

title: THE PROVISION OF POSTAL SERVICES
description:
he Folkestone & Hythe District Council currently have a contract in place for the provision of its Postal Services - mail collection and delivery, which will be expiring on the 31 March 2020 and need to secure a new contract with suitable Supplier for the provision of the services from 01 April 2020. 

The requirement is for the Supplier to be able to collect mail items from the Council's Office and arrange deliveries to any postal address within the UK (including Scotland, Highlands and Islands).

The opportunity is available the Kent Business Portal and can only be accessed via the portal (https://www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk)

title: Quality Assurance and Testing Services RM3810 - Lot 1: QA & Testing Specialists
description:
Testing Services, to support Data, Digital and Technology (DDaT) projects across the DfE. 

The contract will be a "Call Off" and be used as and when services are required, via individual Statements of Work" (SOW).
 

This contract under Lot 1: QA & Testing Specialists and will ensure that there is:

•	Access to a flexible and cost effective pool of Test specialist professionals, bought 'as a service' and capable of delivering services across the full life-cycle of your project or design process
•	continuity of Testing services across DDaT
•	on-going reliability in the provision of testing services.
•	a means for individual work requests to be used to request testing specialists professional.
•	a means for the contracts to be managed as call-off contracts, where individual project teams will continue to be responsible for demonstrating their own business cases, arranging the appropriate spend controls and following the agreed governance & assurance frameworks to call-off any services they require to support delivery of their project(s).

title: Works Contract - Mechanical and Electrical Installation - Boiler Plant
description:
The scope of works shall comprise the supply, installation, testing, commissioning and guaranteeing of the Mechanical and Electrical Installation for a new boiler plant at the National Archives Q2 building, Kew, TW9 4DU. The building is of traditional construction and consists of archive areas on the ground, first and second floors. The plant room is located in the basement.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please email us at procurement@nationalarchives.gov.uk by midday on Monday, August 5th and we will issue the tender package to you.

The deadline for receipt of tender submissions is September 6th, 2019.

We require the works to be completed by January 31st, 2020.

title: Alternative Provider Medical Services for Leeds
description: North of England Commissioning Support worked for and on behalf of NHS England (North) North East and Yorkshire (NHSE) and NHS Leeds Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG) (the Contracting Authorities) who wished to commission Alternative Provider Medical Services (APMS) at the premises currently known as The Light Surgery within the locality of Leeds.The term for the contract is 5 years with the option to extend for a further 2 years, subject to satisfactory financial and contractual performance, with effect from 1 April 2020.

title: HW05661 - UPPER DON FLOOD ALLEVIATION SCHEME (FAS) - PHASE 1 LOXLEY CONFLUENCE
description: The project is the design and construction of linear flood defences along both banks of the river Loxley from Malin bridge to the confluence of the rivers Loxley and Don. The site is generally split into three locations: Holme Lane Defences, Penistone Road Defences and Loxley Confluence Defences. The defences will consist of a combination of new structures and modifications to existing structures and buildings and may include the following: retaining walls, retaining walls with mini-piles, gravity walls, raising and/or strengthening existing walls, ground raising and embankments, bridge parapets, flap valves and flood gates.

title: Syringes Needles and Associated Products
description:
NHS Supply Chain seeks to establish A non-exclusive framework agreement for supply to NHS Supply Chain depots via the stock/Blue Diamond routes and to the NHS Supply Chain customer base via the E-Direct Route.

Details of the NHS Supply chain routes to market can be found in Appendix 4b operational requirements of suppliers.

The framework agreement is for a range of syringes, needles and associated products. Precise quantities are unknown. It is anticipated that that in the first 12 months of the framework agreement the value of purchases will be in the region of circa of 60 000 000 GBP however this is approximate only and the values may vary depending on the requirements of those bodies purchasing under the framework agreement. Estimated value over the maximum 4-year framework agreement will be in the region of 240 000 000 GBP.
streetaddress: DHL Supply Chain Limited acting on behalf of Supply Chain Coordination Ltd acting as agent of the NHS Business Services Authority c/o Skipton House, 80 London Road

See ITT and Schedule of works on  The Chest. Tender submission must be via The Chest.

title: WSCC DR Public Health Services Re-Opening
description:
A contract for the provision of Public Health Services, as described in Documents 2a - g (Service Specification) ("the Contract") is being re-opened for further tendered by West Sussex County Council ("the Council") in accordance with the Light Touch Regime (LTR) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (SI 2015/102) ("the 2015 Regulations"). 
      
      The aim of the procurement process is to seek additional service providers to provide Public Health Services in the County of West Sussex. As such, please note that bidders will not be competing with each other for a place on this contract. All bidders who pass the evaluation stage, as detailed in Parts 3 and 4 below will be offered a place on the approved supplier list. 
      
      The procurement process will be undertaken using the OJEU Open Procedure and will be divided into the following six lots: 
      
      Lot 1: NHS Health Check Services
      Lot 2: Smoking Cessation Services
      Lot 3: Alcohol Identification and Brief Advice Services
      Lot 4: Intrauterine Device Services
      Lot 5: Contraceptive Implant Services 
      Lot 6: Emergency Hormonal Contraception Services

title: Professional Services Administration, Actuarial, Support and Consultancy Services
description:
The Board of the Pension Protection Fund would like to procure a new Framework Agreement of specialist
firms to provide Administration, Actuarial, Support and Consultancy Services.

Lot 1 is primarily for services to the Board where both administration and actuarial services and/or pensions consultancy may be required at the same time, firms on this lot have direct experience in the pensions industry.

Lot 2 is aimed at firms with specialist actuarial capabilities who will have experience in either the pensions or insurance industries. Firms on Lot 2 are therefore able to provide a broad scope of the specified actuarial consultancy services, although not necessarily all, as the intention was to establish a reasonable pool of suppliers who are capable of delivering any specific call-off contract
we intend to seek to award.

NEST may also choose to contract for services via a call-off from the Framework.

The final value of the framework across the maximum term may fall within a huge range as it has been set up to be available for future call-offs for requirements that we may not currently be aware of.

title: Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for Compliance & Facilities Management Services
description:
PROSPER seeks to establish a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for Compliance & Facilities Management Services for use by its Members and other Public Sector Contracting Bodies within North East of England, Cumbria, and North Yorkshire.

The DPS comprises the following Sections / Categories (Lots):
Section 1 - Compliance
• Lot 1 - Heating Services
• Lot 2 - Legionella and Water Hygiene Management and Cyclical Testing
Section 2 - Soft FM
• Lot 3 - Cleaning Services
• Lot 4 - Grounds Maintenance and Landscaping Services
Section 3 - Hard FM
• Lot 5 - Electrical Services
• Lot 6 - Extraction and Ventilation Services
• Lot 7 - Security Systems, Servicing and Maintenance
Section 4 - Full FM Service provision
• Lot 8 - Full FM Service
streetaddress: Mistral House, Kingfisher Way Silverlink Business Park

title: 1-1018 Abnormal Loads Structural Assessment Tool
description:
Highways England is looking to set up a contract for provision of a structural assessment tool starting with a Proof of Concept.
The tool will contribute to key performance indicators in safety, efficiency and user satisfaction, with minor effects on smooth traffic flow and network condition.
A staged approach starting with service design agreed with the HE Portfolio Office and a proof of concept will help ensure that the safety	assessment of abnormal loads travelling over structures is carried out in an SES approved, consistent way, reducing risk and increasing transparency.  The tool will eliminate un-maintained and unapproved assessment processes that are known to present a level of risk to structures.
This task will pave the way for a fully maintained production tool.

title: 1--7 M5 J19-20 Portbury to Clevedon Value Management - Structures
description:
Highways England is looking to award a contract for the provision of Professional Technical Services to:
Assist in the development of the structures renewal schemes programme through the Highways England Value Management Process. Decisions made within this process will be used as a basis for detailed design (by others) and delivery of the Forward Programme. The key outcome for each structure or site will be:
-	A Study into viable options for remedial works varying in scope from low cost Do-Minimum to more robust Do-Something interventions
-	An agreed Preferred Option to be progressed through Detailed Design (by others) 
The Study and Value Management/Scheme Optioneering phase is referred to as Stage 1 and Detailed Design as Stage 2.

title: NU/1524 Provision of Master Planning Design Team for CAV
description: A master planner is to be appointed by Newcastle University to prepare the masterplan and obtain outline planning permission for the site. The masterplan will, through stakeholder engagement and working with the business development consultant (to be appointed by a separate procurement exercise), generate zoning and indicative space requirements for the proposed clusters. These are: Newcastle University Academic Zone, Discovery Crucible, Spectrum of Independence, Integrated Health Hub (NHS), NHS Walk In Centre (existing), residential/commercial zone. The appointed design team will need to develop a masterplan for the full site taking into account the various site ownerships and stakeholder requirements. The service is for the development of the master plan.

title: Professional Kennelling Services
description:
Winchester City Council and Eastleigh Borough Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for Professional Kennelling Services.
      
      Kennelling provision for stray dogs seized within their Districts. The contract offered for tender is for both for the temporary holding of stray dogs and the provision of a public reception centre to act as a public drop off and collection point for strays
      
      The Contract will commence on 01 April 2020 and will be for a period of 4 years
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 17:00 hrs on Friday 21 February 2020.

title: Heat Pump Manufacturing Supply Chain Research Project
description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids is Thursday, 5th December 2019 11:00am.

DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.

All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.

This project will set out the practical steps needed to grow the UK heat pump manufacturing supply chain, including hybrid heat pumps, considering synergies with other industries and the possibility to build on the UK's current expertise in the transition away from fossil fuel heating.

Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Document Uploads tab within the Delta eSourcing Portal. 

This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria set out in the ITQ document. 

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement. 

To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link www.delta-esourcing.com and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: www.delta-esourcing.com and the follow the instructions to 'Login' 

Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: 8ZY8A887S3

Please disregard any content in this notice that requests your organisation "to apply directly to the buyer" as this unfortunately a system generated error, that is outside of the Contracting Authorities control.

title: Pedestrian Footbridge Replacement - Burnside, Exmouth
description: The works comprise of the replacement of the damaged pedestrian footbridge between Burnside and Springfield Road, Exmouth and are to include: design of a replacement footbridge; removal of existing bridge structure; making good of existing abutments foundations; supply of a new bridge; delivery to site; construction/installation onto exiting abutments; tie in to existing footpath.

title: ARCHAEOLOGICAL PLANNING SERVICES FOR GREATER MANCHESTER
description:
•To maintain an efficient service, with clear criteria against which case officers within LPAs are able to identify the need for specialist archaeological advice on planning applications. 
      •To maintain and enhance the Historic Environment Record. Ensure accessibility to the ten LPAs, as well as other users, and encourage greater use of the information by case officers in LPAs when seeking specialist archaeological advice. 
      •To encourage developers to seek specialist archaeological advice and utilise the HER prior to submitting a planning application. 
      •To maximise the research and public benefit value of archaeological investigations

title: TC1005 - Security Services
description:
This contract will extend to the protection of the infrastructure and estate assets that house its core departments such as the Town Hall Complex, Libraries, Parks and public spaces, Schools, Museums, Markets, Cemeteries and Community based projects. Provision of staff for mobile patrols
•	Keyholding and alarm response duties
•	Investigation and verification of alarms including fire  
•	Open / close / lock/ unlock activities at a range of locations
•	Critical location guarding and access control
•	Asset Protection guarding and access control
•	Temporary Asset protection
•	Control Room staffing and CCTV monitoring
•	Car Park monitoring and control
•	First Aid support
•	Emergency and Evacuation duties
•	Incident reporting and design / maintenance of Assignment Instructions
•	Conducting Security Risk Assessments of all locations
•	Provision of a uniformed security service in compliance with legal and statutory constraints
•	Supply of ad hoc and emergency uniformed security personnel
•	Regular deployment of General-Purpose Dogs with trained handlers
•	Supervision and Management of SIA licensed personnel

title: UK SBS DDaT19288 ISS Oracle Apps Support
description:
***Please note this is an award notice not a call for competition***

UK Shared Business Services Ltd have purchase provide extra support in its delivery of change request documentation ("Change Requests") for the upgrade of the Buyer's Oracle E-Business Suite ERP applications and system.

This contract has been award via the CCS RM1557.11 G Cloud 11 Framework.

title: PEDPS Contract 17385 HES Prison Group IAG 2020-2021
description:
The IAG service will provide accurate and impartial information, advice and guidance to help prisoners make decisions on their journey through their sentence. It will provide guidance on the learning, training and work opportunities available whilst in custody and upon release.  The key outcomes of the service are expected to reduce reoffending by: 

-	Supply a service which is confidential to the individual, and which meets the highest standards of equality of opportunity.
-	Alignment of prisoners PLP (Personal Learning Plan) & individual learning whilst in custody.
-	Supporting and advocating basic English and Mathematics development.
-	Provide accurate and impartial information, advice and guidance to both prisoners and potential employers about the education courses, qualifications and training services provided within the Prison.
-	Provide a service that conforms to the standards laid down by Matrix. Staff will be qualified to at least a level 3 award in careers information, advice and guidance.
-	Transferring individuals to the through the gate National Careers Service in community to ensure continuity of service on release and to support their progression into learning and employment  
-	Providing continuity of Service Inspiration, Employer Engagement activity for prisoners whilst in custody and on release to aid their progression opportunities  
-	Suppliers will be expected to use digital platforms to enhance the learner's experience, i.e. use of the Virtual Campus, Passport 2 Employment, Gov.uk.
-	Suppliers will also be expected to work closely with other services and agencies including DWP Work Coach, CFO3 providers, New Futures Network Employment Brokers, CRC's etc. 
-	Suppliers will need to be able to offer a bespoke service aligned with the needs according to the role of each of the prisons.

title: Group Collaboration Software Solution
description:
2428.454.JT.AMRC.19        Group Collaboration Software Solution

The University of Sheffield wishes to invite tenders for a Group Collaboration Software Solution on behalf of the Advanced Manufacturing Research Centre,  Catcliffe, South Yorkshire.

Scope of Requirement
The Advanced Manufacturing Research Centre (AMRC) is seeking to establish a contract for the provision of a Group Collaboration Software Solution (GCSS). The introduction of a GCSS will assist the AMRC in achieving its strategic objectives by creating a collaboration hub, which will provide fast and efficient group-wide communication with real time messaging and data transfer. 

Tender Process and Documentation:
This procurement is an EU open procedure conducted in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015The ITT can be downloaded by registering and expressing your interest on the University`s e-tendering system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield

If you have any questions or comments in relation to this tender they must be submitted via the In-tend System, this can be accessed at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield

Completed tenders must be returned through the same e-tendering system.

Closing date for receipt of tenders: 6th March 2020 at 12 Noon (UK time).

title: West Lancashire Borough Council - Community Grants - Advice Services
description:
Background

Following a review of its support to voluntary organisations, the Council is supporting services for the provision of Information/Advice/Money/Debt services within the Borough through the provision of a Grant.  The Grant will commence from 1 April 2020 for a maximum 3 year period, subject to annual budget processes and satisfactory progress in meeting the outcomes and the indicative measures by the successful Bidder.

Outcomes

Information/Advice/Money/Debt services have been identified as areas of critical need. The Council's investment is expected to help to deliver the following outcomes:-

Support independent living by empowering residents to self-manage (social impact/financial impact)
To reduce potential demand for crisis services by early intervention and prevention
Improve health & wellbeing of residents
Increase the digital skills of residents
Support networking/partnership arrangements between local/national organisations with particular emphasis on local service providers

Tender documents are available via 'The Chest' https://www.the-chest.org.uk   Bidders should visit the 'Current opportunities' page and then click on the drop down menu for 'West Lancashire Borough Council' to access the tender opportunity.

Tenders must be submitted by 9/12/2019 2.00pm via https://the-chest.org.uk.

Clarifications in relation to this requirement must be submitted via the messaging system within 'The Chest' https://www.the-chest.org.uk by 03/12/19 2.00pm.

title: Forest School and Nursery - Staffordshire University
description: Staffordshire University are investing in a new purpose built day care nursery with additional capacity for a classroom and observational suite with leading digital technology. It is also proposed as part of the new nursery provision to take the opportunity to incorporate a 'forest school' facility together with associated ground works around the nature reserve. This will support student retention, provide additional surplus income, attract and engage potential students, staff and community.

title: KMCLGM-006 Developing The Kirklees Standard
description: Appointment of an organisation to help Kirklees Council develop the Kirklees Standard, which will place the voice of the citizen at the heart of our corporate planning and the measurement of the delivery against our outcomes.  The work to develop the Standard should be carried out in a way that is co-produced with key stakeholders, including citizens and partners.  The contract will run for an initial period of nine (9) months with the option to extend the contract by up to a maximum of three (3) further months.

title: 2020-02-17 1000 QFX013: Ipswich - Causton Junior School, Ipswich - AWARD
description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `The supply of Passenger Transport Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2018/S 031-067685.
      
      QFX013: Ipswich - Causton Junior School, Ipswich (Requirement for 4 seat vehicle with passenger assistant).
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is Monday 17th February 2020 at 1000. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is Friday 14th February 2020 at 1600 which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website

title: INVITATION TO TENDER FOR DESIGN & BUILD OF NEW TODDLER & JUNIOR PLAY AREA, SEVEN STARS ROAD, LEYLAND
description:
South Ribble Borough Council is inviting tenders for the design and build of a new toddler and junior play area, Seven Stars Road, Leyland as detailed more fully in the Specification.  The Council's set budget for this project is £175,000.  

The project involves the removal of the existing play equipment and associated rubber surfacing and design & build of a new play area for toddlers and juniors at the open space at Seven Stars Road, Leyland, PR25 1HW.  It is anticipated that the project will commence on 13th January 2020 and will be complete by 30th April 2020.

Interested bidders should register their interest via the Chest at www.the-chest.org.uk in order to access the full specification and invitation to tender documentation. The deadline for expressions of interest is 5pm Friday 15th November 2019. Completed tender documents must be submitted and received via the Chest by no later than 12 Noon Monday 18th November 2019.

title: GB-London: Consolidated Search
description:
The consolidated search will need to retrieve data from RMG's collections and archive database (Mimsy), library database (Symphony), as well as RMG's library and archive bookings system (Aeon). The aim is to provide a single point of reference for all researchers.
      
      Work on the Collections Online website and Consolidated Search will run concurrently. In order to achieve this, we require the Consolidated Search suppliers to:
      •Agree on interface (March)
      •Deliver a beta version to support the development of the website (end of April)
      •Be available during the development stage to advise on and adapt the search functionality (May/June)
      •Delivery final version (June)

title: Independent visitor services for children looked after
description:
The London Borough of Bromley ("the Council") is seeking bids for provision of Independent Visitor Service for Children Looked After.

Independent Visitors provide a support and befriending service to children and young people who are in care. This service originated in the 1989 Children Act for children who had little or no contact with their birth family. However, changes to the statutory guidance in the 2008 Act now mean that any young person in care is now eligible for this service if it appears to be in the child's interests to do so. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                               The contract will commence on 1st August 2020 and be for a period of three years with an option to extend on a one plus one (1 + 1) basis at the sole discretion of the Council.

title: RA279585 - X24 - Hospital Discharge Protocol
description:
NHS Shared Business Services, on behalf of the NHSE&I Learning Disability and Autism Programme, are looking to commission a piece of work to facilitate the identification of housing options earlier and to enable Commissioners to better gain an understanding of the options within the context of hospital discharges.  - The deadline for clarification questions is 25/02/20 at 17.00. 

Responses to the clarification questions will be sent out, no later than 48 business hours after the deadline. 
 - To access this competition: login to https://suppliers.multiquote.com and view the opportunity RA279585. Not registered on MultiQuote - visit https://suppliers.multiquote.com then register and quote RA279585 as the reason for registration. Any queries please contact MultiQuote on 0151 482 9230.

title: Bus Timetabling and Publicity ICT system
description:
Across the borough there is over 2,278 bus stops, of which 1,593 locations have public transport information displayed.  Real Time Passenger Information is provided at Chester Bus Interchange and on-street in Forgeate Street, Chester Railway station and very soon in Northwich. The Council is committed to ensuring that Public Transport is more attractive and is easier to use in the future. Getting people to the right place at the right time is essential to the smooth operation of any transport network. 

2.2	What we are buying and why
A bus timetabling and publicity ICT solution.
2.3 What we require: the solution
The Strategic Transport team is customer focused and committed to delivering an excellent service to its residents in the provision of public transport information across the borough. This is successfully achieved through maintaining roadside information at bus stops, producing timetables leaflets and travel information for bus stations, alongside providing regular updates to Traveline.  The system must be intuitive and flexible to ensure the efficient delivery of public transport at a local or national. 

The Council has embraced a cloud-first approach as part of its IT strategy and prefer where possible, the sourcing of solutions that will be offered to the customer as Software as a Service (SaaS).
buyer: Cheshire west and Chester Borough Council

title: Arthroscopy, Sports Medicine Implants and Instruments
description:
This tender is to establish framework for the supply of Arthroscopy which encompasses devices to
undertake; arthroscopic access in terms of ports and systems required to maintain clear images during a
procedure, resection devices and associated consumables for the removal of spurs and soft tissue, all related
implants and instrumentation for soft tissue repair or replacement. The successful tenderer will be expected
to provide free of charge supporting services such as training, education, clinical support, reporting and cost
reduction initiatives.

The tender will consist of five individual lots as below
Lot 1 Access and Fluid Management (pumps and tubing)
Lot 2 Resection (mechanical, Radio Frequency and ablation)
Lot 3 Implants and Associated Instruments (all Implants and Instruments)
Lot 4 Service, Maintenance, Repair and Standby Systems

All tenderers are encouraged to bid for all lots.
buyer: HealthTrust Europe LLP (HTE) acting as agent for the University Hospitals of Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust ("UHCW")

title: Nuclear Innovation and Research Office
description: The Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) seeks to award a new three- year contract to the National Nuclear Laboratory (NNL) Ltd to deliver the Nuclear Innovation and Research Office - starting on 1 April 2020 and running to 31 March 2023, with the option of extending  . The contract includes: providing Government with impartial technical advice on a range of nuclear policy, programmes and strategic issues; programme support to the BEIS Nuclear Innovation Programme; representing Government in certain international fora; and acting as a Secretariat for the Nuclear Innovation and Research Advisory Board (NIRAB). The advisory function NIRO will be separated from NNL's commercial business by a series of ethical barriers.

title: 1-995 Phase 3 TSS-PR Documentation upgrade for CHARM
description:
Highways England is looking to set up a contract to provide the Operational Technology Engineering and Architecture Services Group with specialist technical support and advice to undertake the upgrade of documentation to meet the requirements of the new CHARM architecture. The operational technology environment is changing significantly. Major developments underway are introducing completely new ways in which Highways England manages its operational technology systems, services and equipment. These developments facilitate a more adaptable approach to cater for the ever changing and evolving nature of operational technology.
These changing needs put demands on the existing technology, which may require either enhancements to existing or development of new functionality/new products.
To ensure that the supply chain understands the technical requirements of this new computer architecture environment much of the existing documentation needs to be upgraded.

title: SBC-01-2020-58CW-Rear Extension - AWARD
description:
Stevenage Borough Council are currently seeking quotes for the provision and Construction of a rear extension to provide ground floor, level access bathing facilities. (Conventional Build or SIP Panel Construction)
      The quotation documents can be accessed from the 'My Tenders' area of the Supply Hertfordshire website and selecting the 'View Details' button of this project.
      Please note the deadline for returns and allow sufficient time to make your return as late returns will not be permitted.
      Any questions relating to this quote should be made via correspondence on the website and can be addressed to the main contact as shown in the details above.

title: Labour Services
description:
EEM are looking to establish a dynamic purchasing system (DPS) to engage a range of providers that are able to deliver a diverse range of Labour Services and Associated Works; the categories of services are as follows;
Electricians
Joiners/Carpenters
Plasterers
Plumbers
Heating Engineers
Painters/Decorators
Multi Skilled Operatives
Submissions to join the DPS can be made at any time and will remain open for application for 5 years and will operate through the Geometra Portal.
This DPS has been created for EEM Members to directly employ additional trade labour to assist their in house teams or any Contractor with their resources on an adhoc and short-term scale. This DPS is not suitable for recruitment agencies.
The procurement process will be run in accordance with the following programme:
First Mini Tenders released from: 06.04.2020.
DPS end date: 28.03.2025.

The organisations that are successful in being awarded a place on the DPS will be given a "pre-approved"status and will be invited to submit a formal bid when EEM Members have a requirement to contract the work stream associated with this DPS. Each application to join the DPS will be reviewed by EEM to ensure the minimum criteria for entry onto the DPS is met. The minimum criteria for entry onto the DPS are detailed in Online Supplier Selection Questionnaire Evaluation.

EEM Members are currently located throughout England and Wales and as such opportunities arising from this DPS will be in various geographical areas. For a full update list of the current EEM members please visit www.eem.org.uk
Please note that the total potential value stated in II.2.6) is for the full 5-year DPS period and takes into consideration that the EEM membership may grow over the life of the DPS period. No guarantees are given for values and volumes.
This DPS is being established by Efficiency East Midlands Ltd ("EEM") on behalf of their members and the other organisations described below as being Authorised Users. The following Contracting Authorities will be entitled to agree and award contracts through the DPS system:
1) Any Member of EEM. A full list of current Members is available at www.eem.org.uk
2) Any future Member of EEM, and in all cases being an organisation which has applied to join EEM in accordance with the applicable constitutional documents;
3) An EEM Participant being an organisation which is neither a current or EEM Member (as defined at 1 above)nor a Future Member of EEM (as defined at 2 above) based within England and Wales which owns and/or maintains/manages housing stock in 1 or more geographic area in which it operates and/or is an NHS Trust(which includes Acute Trusts, Mental Trusts, Care Services Trusts and Ambulance Trusts) or organisation,police authority, fire authority, ambulance trust, university, higher education, further education college, school academy or other public sector organisation.
streetaddress: Unit 3, Maisies Way, South Normanton, Alfreton

title: Leasing & Servicing of Sterile Services Vans
description:
The Sterile Services Department at the Cumberland Infirmary Carlisle site currently have two ADR plated transport vehicles. One of which leaves and returns to site three times daily, Monday to Friday and minimum once and up to three times per weekend. 
The vans journey between The Cumberland Infirmary and Whitehaven Hospital  
The vans are swapped round weekly to ensure wear and tear is managed effectively. 
The requirement for two vans is due to them requiring ADR plating for the transport of class 6 Infectious Substances and class 7 Radiation and the need for there to be a van available at all times.
buyer: North Cumbria University Hospitals Nhs Trust Charitable Fund

title: Invitation to Tender for 4-yr Grass Cutting Contract
description:
Rowlands Castle Parish Council hereby gives notice of its intention to award a 4-year contract, subject to satisfactory performance in the first year, to provide grass cutting services on land for which it is responsible within the Parish.  

Contractors interested in submitting tenders are asked to liaise with the specified contact for a detailed specification and instructions.

The deadline for receipt of tenders is 5pm on Monday 27 January 2020.

title: Invitation to Tender for Grounds Maintenance Contract/s
description:
Broadstairs & St. Peter's Town Council is inviting contractors, companies or sole traders to tender for a two-year contract for the following tasks:

a)	Maintenance and gardening of the area of Pierremont Park in the ownership of Broadstairs & St. Peter's Town Council Address: Pierremont Hall, Pierremont Avenue, CT10 1JX (see appendix 1).
b)	Grass cutting and maintenance of Culmer's Amenity Land. Address: adj. Vere Road Car Park, CT10 1JF (see appendix 2).

You are invited to bid on both contracts or individually as you prefer. 

Contracts to commence on 1st April 2019 and end on 31st March 2021.

title: SBC 12/19  Broad Oak Way Play Area Design and Build - AWARD
description:
Stevenage Borough Council are currently seeking quotes for the provision of Design and Build Play area improvements at the Broad Oak Way Play Area
      The quotation documents can be accessed from the 'My Tenders' area of the Supply Hertfordshire website and selecting the 'View Details' button of this project.
      
      Please note the deadline for returns and allow sufficient time to make your return as late returns will not be permitted.
      Any questions relating to this quote should be made via correspondence on the website and can be addressed to the main contact as shown in the details above.

title: CR20001 - Hartree Centre Annual Beneficiary Outcome Survey
description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids was Friday, 31st January 2020 at 11:00.

Brief Description of Requirement:

This research will form the first activity of implementing an ongoing programme of outcome and impact evaluation for the Hartree Centre. It is envisaged that this work will inform a more detailed evaluation insight which will support establishing baselines for the Centre's next stage of funding.

This contract was awarded based on the evaluation criteria set out in the Mini Competition document.

title: Diversity and Inclusion Review
description: The purpose of this procurement process is for The National Archives (TNA) to select a supplier to conduct a diversity and inclusion review of both the Archives Revealed funding programme and the Collaborate and Innovate funding programme. The review is to examine the literature, the eligibility criteria, the application process, the guidance and the support given by administrators during and after the application process. The research is to highlight potential bias and barriers to application.

title: Executive Sensei Programme - NHS Executive Lean Coaching and Mentoring
description:
NHS Trust Development Authority requires delivery of expert coaching and mentoring (Executive Sensei) support to NHS Chief Executive's and Boards to augment their Lean development as part of the Vital Signs Programme.
Vital Signs is a programme to enable an NHS Improvement Practice to help transform and continuously improve the delivery of what patients want and value with the best use of resources founded on Lean Principles and Systems Thinking to promote improvement stream unification around a common target of an NHS Improvement Practice. Vital Signs is a learning network to support all those on the improvement journey in the NHS no matter their starting point, current position, improvement model, or coach/sensei.

Please visit the Mytenders portal to download the tender documents.https://www.mytenders.co.uk/Default.aspx

The Mytenders reference for this requirement is FEB159285 

Clarification questions and proposal submissions will be via Mytenders.

title: 121_20 Sandwiches, Food-to-Go, Confectionery and Snacks
description:
Supply of a range of sandwiches, food-to-go, confectionery and snack products. 

Lot 1: Sandwiches and Food-to-Go - Supply of a range of sandwiches and food-to-go products, to include but not limited to salads, snack pots, sushi and other related products.

Lot 2: Confectionery and Snacks - Supply of a range of confectionery and snack items, to include but not limited to chocolate bars, sweets, biscuits, cake bars and crisps.

The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 24 months. The total estimated value stated includes the option period.

An eAuction process may be used to award subsequent call off contracts following the reopening of competition among the parties to the Framework Agreement.

As a Central Purchasing Body as defined by the EU Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU, the Framework Agreement is open for use by Public Bodies (defined at https://www.espo.org/ESPO/media/Documents/FAQs/ESPO-s_powers_to_trade__website_-2016-12-22.pdf) that also fall into one of the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authorities; Educational Establishments (including Academies); Central Government Departments and Agencies; Police, Fire & Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services; NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services; Registered Charities; Registered Social Landlords; The Corporate Office of the House of Lords, The Corporate Officer of the House of Commons; or any public body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas are available at: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal

To tender: (a) Go towww.eastmidstenders.org, (b) Register (c) Search for tender opportunity '121_20' d) Express an interest (e)Download the tender from the website.

Please note: the closing date/time for submission of tenders is 12:00 midday, 18/03/2020.

title: SE937 - The Provision of Active Places Data Validation 2020
description:
This Invitation to Tender (ITT) relates to the award procurement for the Active Places Data Validation 2020 .

Sport England as the contracting authority is tendering for the supply of the Active Places Data Validation. Sport England is seeking through this tendering process to award a contract with a suitably capable Contractor to provide the contract for an initial term of 36 months and a unilateral option of Sport England to extend for two further periods of 12 months. The anticipated contract value is £2.4m (exc. VAT) over the maximum contract period, with the option to extend.

title: Robert Watson Garden Charitable Funds Project
description:
The Northampton General Hospital NHS Trust (NGH) is looking to identify a supplier for the Robert Watson Garden Charitable Funds Project. The appointed supplier will work closely with the Trust's Capital Projects Team and Northamptonshire Health Charity                                                                                                                                                                                               
DN464990 - The tender pack sets out the information which is required in order to assess the suitability of applicants to meet the Trust's requirements.

The successful applicant will be required to deliver services in accordance with all attached documents and the contract to be placed. The contract will be subject to Northampton General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust's requirements and satisfactory performance through continuous monitoring and performance review.  During the contract life, the successful applicants will need to achieve continuous improvement.  Failure to do so may result in the contract being terminated. 
The entire tendering process must be carried out through the ProActis (Due North) ProContract system. The use of ProActis Due North will ensure the safe and efficient transfer of tender documentation sent on behalf of the client to the contractor and by the contractor back to the client.  Automatic access to the tender documentation will be granted on completion of registration to the ProActis Due North site. 
To register and access the documents please use the following link: 
https://procontract.due-north.com/SupplierRegistration/Requirements
We advise you to check that you have registered either a minimum of 2 addresses within your company, or else a group address (e.g. sales@...) which is regularly checked by more than one person.  This will help to ensure that you will receive any additional information that we publish and that you will be able to submit your Tender, even if a key person is absent.
To prevent your IT system from treating web based messages from Due North as junk or spam, please mark ProContract Notifications as a "safe" sender, and/or ensure that registered addressees check their "Junk" folder regularly to pick up any such messages before they are automatically deleted.
For technical help on using ProContract Due North, please contact the support team at procontractsuppliers@proactis.com  or call them on +44 (0)1670 597120

title: CPU 3666 - Adventure Play Area - Nottingham Castle
description: NCC required and awarded the contract to a suitably qualified and experienced specialist play designer/contractor to design, supply and install an Adventure Play Area. NCC are looking for original and exciting designs and concepts for this project, shaped by the history and topography of the site and the overarching aims of the project. The new design will require Planning and Scheduled Monument consent. This is part of the £30m Nottingham Castle Project, a collaboration between Nottingham City Council (NCC) and the National Lottery Heritage Fund (NLHF) is transforming the Castle into a world-class heritage destination. Refurbishment work to the Ducal Palace and castle grounds and the construction of the new Visitor Centre has been in progress since late 2018.

title: 1920CCG04 Tax Compliance in the Charity Sector
description:
Research on the support needs of charitable organisations in relation to tax.

To improve HMRC's ability to support charities to get their tax right the first time, this mixed-methods research will explore charity Trustees understanding of tax compliance rules, as well as identifying potential enablers and barriers of tax compliance.

title: Veterinary and Paraprofessional Training, Authorisation and Assurance Services
description:
The Authority is looking for a supplier for Veterinary and Paraprofessional Training and related services. A single Supplier is required to supply a complete system of training, revalidation and centralised records for veterinarians, technicians and paraprofessionals delivering Government-related veterinary, veterinary-related or other public health functions.

This procurement is being carried out in accordance with the principals set out in the Regulations. The Contract will be awarded as a Services Concession Contract, in accordance with the definition provided in the Concession Contract Regulations 2016, sections 3 - 5.

title: Smithfield Architect
description: The City of London Corporation ('the City') has procured a design team to mid RIBA Stage 2 with respect to the Grade II* Smithfield East and West Market buildings, their generous basement, and the associated Grade II Rotunda. This is a site of considerable heritage and the successful team will be expected to demonstrate high quality design expertise as well as considerable experience of successfully working with listed structures. The team will include the following services; architect, structural, and cost consultant.

title: Smithfield Area Public Realm Design
description:
The City of London has appointed a consultant for a once-in-a-generation opportunity for
transforming the West Smithfield area public realm into an exceptional civic space.
This historic part of the city will go thought major transformations with the delivery of the recently adopted city
transport strategy and the development of culture mile, as well as the Museum of London move to the site and
the announcement of the relocation of the Smithfield Central Market in a new consolidated site.
The aspiration is to develop a design for the future public realm which is flexible and future proof considering
all these changes in a holistic way. The aim of the brief is to produce designs for public realm transformation in
Smithfield to include concept design and developed design stages.

title: WEST NORWOOD CEMETERY CONSERVATION AND REPAIR SERVICES
description:
London Borough of Lambeth seeks to appoint a skilled consultancy team to lead the conservation and repair capital works (RIBA Stages 4-7) within one of London's historic sites, West Norwood Cemetery.  Specialisms required for Lot 1 include conservation and landscape architecture and project coordination and for Lot 2 civil engineering.
The delivering of capital works (RIBA works 4-7) is being offered in 2 Lots: 
Lot 1: Consultancy services and project co-ordination for conservation capital works  at West Norwood Cemetery 

And

Lot 2: Consultancy services for civil engineering (footpaths and drainage works)  at West Norwood Cemetery 

Organisations wishing to tender must demonstrate they can deliver high quality consultancy services, with previous experience of working in a historic setting and in particular historic cemeteries or parks/open spaces as well as demonstrating an understanding of the conservation specialisms which will be required during this project. 


Separate LBL appointments:  LBL will be making  separate appointments for an interpretation specialist, to oversee the implementation of the internal and external interpretation and exhibitions. Also LBL will be making a separate appointment for a Quantity Surveyor. All consultants will be required to work with these consultants when appointed.

title: MPS FRAMEWORK FOR SUPPLY AND DELIVERY OF OPERATIONAL AMMUNITION
description:
The MPS is seeking through an OJEU Restricted Procedure (two stage procurement process) potential suppliers for Supply and Delivery of Ammunition - Various Calibres. See list below.

The procurement opportunity is advertised through Bluelight EU Supply (e-tendering portal).  Potential suppliers must be registered in order to view tender documentation and download.

LOT 1	7.62mm x 35mm (300 Blackout) Supersonic
LOT 2      5.56mm x 45 mm
LOT 3	7.62mm x 35mm (300 Blackout) Subsonic
LOT 4	9mm x 19mm
streetaddress: Empress State Building, Lillie Road, Earls Court

title: SUPPLY OF C2A2 OF SIGHT UNIT SPARES AND ASSOCIATED ITEMS
description:
Other additional information: The Authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy.  If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security Aspects Letter), the Authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise.  The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.
      
      https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/government-security-classifications
      
      Electronic Trading. Potential suppliers must note the mandatory requirement for electronic trading currently via email invoicing, with Babcock DSG Limited.
      
      The Cyber risk level is low and the Risk Assessment Reference RAR code is RAR-9CDU6MD2. All Potential Operators who are invited to tender must complete the Supplier Assurance Questionnaire (SAQ) via the Supplier Cyber Protection Service (Octavian) https://supplier-cyber-protection.service.gov.uk/ to demonstrate their compliance with the required cyber risk level. This is a self-assurance process and no validation of the SAQ return is required.
      
      
       Advertising Regime OJEU:- This contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU),the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk
      
      Justification For Non-Competitive Decision: It is considered this requirement can be placed using the negotiated procedure without prior publication pursuant to Article 25(1)(a) of Directive 2009/81/EC (Regulation 16(1)(a)(i) of the Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations 2011) due to the absence of suitable tenders in response to the previous restricted procedure reference 2019/S 146-360833. In respect of the previous restricted procedure, the UK Ministry of Defence received a single tender response and that tender was evaluated as being commercially non-compliant.
      Optical instruments. Babcock DSG Limited, which is acting as the agent for the UK Ministry of Defence known as the Authority, is considering a Framework Agreement to Supply spares and associated items for the C2A2 Sight Unit.

To access this competition: 

Registered:
Login to https://suppliers.multiquote.com and view the opportunity CA7059.

Not registered:
Visit https://suppliers.multiquote.com then register and quote CA7059 as the reason for registration. 

 Any queries please contact MultiQuote on 0151 482 9230.

title: LPS CORP - Provision of Consultancy Services - GLP Workstream 1 - RFQ 15253419
description:
The council is inviting tenders for the provision of consultancy services to provide a comprehensive Independent Economic Review in relation to The Greater Lancashire Plan.

The tender documents are available on Lancashire County Council's electronic tendering site https:// www.lancashire.gov.uk/iSupplier/. Use of this system does not require high specification IT equipment or connections, nor high level personal IT skills/capabilities. Access to the system/software and advice is free of charge.

title: The Development of Apprenticeship Standards in the NHS - Health Education England - PIN - NHS/SoEPS/20.640
description:
NHS South of England Procurement Services (SoEPS), acting on behalf of Health Education England (HEE - the Commissioner) are putting out this notice as a PIN (Prior Information Notice) with a view to completing a Direct Award.

Please note the contracting authority intends to direct award the contract to Skills for Health for a short period of time while it determines the authority's commissioning intentions. The case for direct award can be found on the tender portal.

HEE believe that Skills for Health is the only supplier who can support the above programme requirements for one year in 2020/21, with their technical expertise and experience (since 2016) in order to maintain  continuity (from 1 April 2020 until 31 March 2021) to fulfill HEE's mandate deliverables (developing new apprenticeship standards for clinical and non-clinical jobs in the NHS) and the actions  of the Long Term Plan and People Plan (such as offering important opportunities for widening social participation in the NHS workforce providing and career ladders for staff to develop their skills).

It is envisaged that while the current specifications are underway in 2020, an open procurement process will be undertaken for work to be started in April 2021 onwards (2-3 years).

The contract period of one year will be a maximum value of £550,000 exclusive of VAT.  

For the Specification, Contract and the case for direct award please access the portal at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/soepscommissioning

Project title: The Development of Apprenticeship Standards in the NHS - Health Education England - NHS/SoEPS/20.640

Please access the portal for all documents.  

Should providers have any problems using the portal, they should contact the In-tend dedicated Supplier Helpdesk by calling 0845 557 8079 Monday to Friday (9am to 5pm) or email support@in-tend.co.uk

All communications should be made via the messaging function on the In-tend E-Tendering portal. 
 
If any provider has concerns with the commissioning intentions outlined within the published documentation, please raise this via the Intend eTendering Portal in the first instance within 30 days of the date of this Prior Information Notice.

The closing date of this PIN is midnight on the 23rd March 2020.
