title: GB-Leeds: R/3706 - Supply of an integrated Laboratory-Scale Fibre Analyser and Associated Software System.
description:
Notice of award of an integrated Laboratory-Scale Fibre Analyser and Associated Software System. 
      
      
      The purpose of the Laboratory Fibre Analyser and Software System is to enable the characterisation of the dimensions and mechanical properties of fibrous materials, under both dry and wet conditions.

title: Tender for the Provision of E-Bikes 2020
description:
Sheffield City Council (SCC) is wishing to purchase 195 hybrid e bikes, which are split in to 3 Lots: 
Lot 1a: 164 Hybrid e-bikes 
Lot 1b: 21 Small framed e-bikes 
Lot 2: 10 Trekking style e-bikes, suitable for Enforcement/Police type operations
For access to tender information and documents, please visit www.yortender.co.uk and search for DN466410.

title: The Provision Of  Domiciliary Care for Children and Young People with a Disability
description:
•To provide a short break service in the community, that enhances the wellbeing of children and young people with a disability and offers parents and carers a break from their caring role.
      
      •To provide a safe and exciting environment for children with complex health needs to be away from their home for a specified period of time.
      •To offer structured sessions and setting objectives and outcomes for each child.
      
      •To support parents and carers in encouraging children to enjoy and achieve
      
      •To provide 1:1 support to families of children and young people who have a disability, with complex needs 
      
      •To provide a good level of competent staff to support children and young people with a disability to access a programme of activities and develop their independent skills

title: School Aged Immunisation Service for Shropshire and Telford & Wrekin
description:
NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands Commissioning Support Unit (NHS Arden and GEM CSU) on behalf of NHS England (Public Health, North Midlands) invited suitably qualified providers to deliver a School Aged Immunisation Service in Shropshire (including Telford and Wrekin). 

The contract is for an initial period of 3 years with the option to extend for a further 1 year.  The contract start date was 1st September 2019.  

Immunisations to be included are:
• Meningococcal C (MenC) - containing vaccine (Meningitis ACWY) Immunisation Programme, Years 9 school cohort years. **This vaccine should be offered to older unimmunised school aged individuals who may self-refer**
• Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) Immunisation Programme for girls, Years 8 and 9 school cohort years
• Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) Immunisation Programme for boys, Years 8 and 9 school cohort years
• TD/IPV (Teenage Booster) Immunisation Programme, Years 9 school cohort years. **This vaccine should be offered to older unimmunised school aged individuals who may self-refer**
• Seasonal influenza immunisation programme for children (AGE) Reception to Year 6 school cohort years
• Possible MMR Catch up cohort programme to support the national strategy on elimination of MMR
buyer: NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands Commissioning Support Unit

title: Greater Huddersfield CCG: The Nook Group Practice, Primary Care Medical Services
description:
Following receipt of notice from the previous contractor, NHS Greater Huddersfield Clinical Commissioning Group
appointed an interim provider to provide safe, high quality; effective GP led primary medical care until 31st March
2020. The CCG is now looking to appoint a provider under an APMS contract for a period of five years.
Opening hours and service delivery from 8:00 to 18:30 Monday to Friday, (except statutory bank and public
holidays).

Interested Providers will be required to provide core primary care services which will include GP and clinical
sessions in line with patient demand
The population currently served are in the following geographic areas:
• Golcar
• Salendine Nook
The average number of patients registered with the practice is expected to be between 2220 and 3440.

title: Abbey Academies Trust - Tender for Cleaning Services
description:
The successful Supplier will be required to provide cleaning services for Abbey Academies Multi Academy Trust.

Abbey Academies Multi Academy Trust is expected to grow with a number of additional schools becoming part of the Trust during this contract period. The provision of cleaning services at these schools when they have joined the Trust will fall under the scope of this contract. The successful supplier will be expected to provide this service at these additional schools using the same costing model applied to the successful tender submission. The duration of contract for these schools will not be increased and they will join the contract for the remaining contract period that exists at the point of entry into the Trust.

The 2 Schools in Bourne are 1,7 miles apart (further information regarding the schools is provided in the SQ Document).

The contract will commence on 1.1.2020 for an initial period of 3 years, ending on 31.12.2022, with the opportunity to extend for a further period of 2 years at the discretion of the governing body.

This contract will be fixed price in nature with the successful supplier guaranteeing both the number of input hours to the contract and the quality of cleaning provision.

We are seeking a suitably experienced supplier who has current experience of working within the primary school market place, ideally with a strong operational base within the Lincolnshire area, thus allowing for both adequate contract support and operational flexibility that is to be delivered to support the contract as and when required moving forwards into this contract term.

The scope of the contract covers all cleaning provision within the school buildings. The successful Supplier will be expected to deliver a concise and detailed method of management reporting at the end of each month, thus updating the school senior management team on the contract performance.

Any variations to the contract that are requested by the client should be invoiced at the agreed rate and should be calculated on an hourly rate per employee needed to carry out the variation to the satisfaction of the contract supervising officer. The client's requirement shall be for 190 academic days, 5 inset days and 10 days periodic cleaning per annum.

Whilst the monthly charge will represent 1-twelfth of the contract cost, a reconciliation will take place monthly to reconcile the actual hours worked within the contract. If the hours worked are less than those budgeted for a credit will be required by the client. The client requires that the tendered amount of hours are worked at all times and the successful supplier is expected to have a system in place to cover for both planned and unplanned leave.

The supplier shall provide a comprehensive cleaning service to the client so as to promote a clean, healthy and safe environment which presents a positive image to all users and visitors.

(Further information is provided in the SQ Document.)

title: CETE107 A624 Swallow House Lane Bridge Bearing Replacement
description:
Derbyshire County Council is seek to appoint a Principle Contractor for the A624 Swallow House Lane, Bridge Bearing Replacement.   The works comprise:-
Provide, design, construction, installation and maintain until the defects date all
necessary works, comprising the design and installation of Bearings at the
Abutments, Major Maintenance Works to Bearings at Piers and Bridge
Expansion Joints and Carriageway Resurfacing.
The proposed Works also include widening the existing abutments.
The appointed contractor will be required to demonstrate experience in design
and installation of bearings schemes to major highway structures.
